Reviews.Title: “One Night”
Reviews.Author: 206jazz
Reviews.Content: The lobby is on floor 12, parking on floor 11, room on floor 27 at the top. We only stayed one night for a quick trip to San Diego. In that 24 hours you really do get dizzy circling the parking lot up and down to the 11th floor. The hotel is a bit aged but clean. The suite divides the bedroom area from the living area which make both seem rather small. As it was only one night stay it was OK as we were out of the hotel most of the time and there only to sleep. II went again I would stay closer to the Gaslamp area for less driving to eats. As a Starwood member we were given a choice to have free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay right in downtown”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying in downtown San Diego. It's a great walking city. This is a very convenient hotel. We walked through Gaslamp and all the way down to Seaport Village and the harbor area. The guys out front were very helpful with directions and even helped us find a good dinner spot in Little Italy during one of our many walks. Room is a good size...we had 2 queen beds. I liked that I could work in the in the room and close the french doors while my daughter slept in the bedroom. Wi-fi was the best I've experienced in awhile. Only went down a few times. Room is very quiet....slept like a baby. The only improvement I could suggest is to update the bathroom...that door has just got to go, and the whole bathroom could use a makeover. Really enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Practical”
Reviews.Author: GregorCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unasuming, the breakfast nothing special, but it is the onbly hotel I know with a concert hall in the ground floor. What luxury just to take the lift down to the concerts.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel,helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: ayhanbalim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Sheraton Suits San Diego for 2 nights,between 5 th. of March and 7.th of March 2012.It was reallly very nice hotel.Because of our membership of SPG,the front desk had upgraded us as soon as we reached the hotel.The front desk is very helpful and kind.There is free internet and PC. in front of the front desk 24 hours.There is cofee maker and complementry cofee and tea ,microwave in the room.The hotel is rather near of the airport,taxi doesn't cost so much.Gaslamp quarter is worth to see ,many nice restaurants.You can easily walk to the Gas Lamp quarter.I would like to come back again.San Diego is a very nice city.

Reviews.Title: “About a three and a half star.”
Reviews.Author: LSmithTO
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 4 nights. It is within walking distance to the Gaslamp district. They call this hotel Sheraton Suites but one would expect a kitchenette in a suite. There was a microwave but no fridge. We called the front desk and they sent a mini fridge up. The room was the size of a slightly larger than average hotel room but just separated by french doors. The pull out couch was atrocious if you actually needed to pull it out. I sat down on it and instantly sunk to the floor! No, I am not overweight. My child could not sleep on this. There were two beds in the bedroom so we managed. The bathroom door has a sliding door that is a pain. It makes a horrible banging noise when you close it, hence waking up everyone in the middle of the night if you have to use it. The parking sucks. You have to spiral up 7 floors (until you are green) and then wind up another 4 floors until you get to the Sheraton parking. After that you need to take an elevator up one floor. Then you are in the lobby. Then you can finally take an elevator up to your floor. A tad convoluted, don't you think? All for the price of $23 a day! With the bad out of the way I will get to the good. It is not a fine hotel. Good location. The rooms are clean. They even provide wine glasses which I find unusual for a Sheraton. The staff was wonderful. The bartenders in the lounge were very, very personable. I'm sorry I didn't get their names. In fact, all of the staff we encountered went out of their way to be very friendly. We really appreciate this. The pool was small but according to my children who are connoisseurs of hotel pools, "fun". We had a wonderful time in San Diego and I would suck it up (parking) and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not sure it was worth the splurge.”
Reviews.Author: Nanci P
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very nice and the room was clean. We needed a fridge for my husbands meds and I disliked having to pay extra. We had a some technical issues with keys, the bathroom door refused to open and other things. The staff responded quickly. I'm just not sure it was worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy place to spreadout and chill for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: ocmom1
Reviews.Content: Did a 2 night getaway for the weekend and decided to stay at the Sheraton since we never have been there and both Westins and the W seem to have construction going on right now. Self parking was different; it's a structure in the building and doesn't start until you spiral up to level 7, but get yourself to level 11 and take the elevator to level 12 for check-in. Valet at the street was helpful and courteous. Check in desk was very friendly and got us our club upgrade we wanted. We ended up at the top floor and on the end so I think we got lucky with a quiet room and a nice view. The room was suite setup which made it roomy for us staying the 2 days and we were able to chill in the room and spread out a little. You can definitely here your neighbors when they were in the hallway but we heard nobody from other rooms. We visited the workout room it had various cardio and one weight center, no free weights. It was very small but did provide what we both needed. Indoor pool we didn't use, but some other folks were enjoying it one morning. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the lounge both days. Cook to order omelets and all the normal hot and cold breakfast items. Fruit was awesome. Self - Parking was $24 a day and it was in and out all day which we did use a couple of times, but most of the time we just walked through Gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice size room, updated, but only partially”
Reviews.Author: EdmondsWA
Reviews.Content: Sheraton people at the front desk were nice enough. Housekeeping was responsive. Sheraton advertises rooms are updated, but truth be told - rooms are only partially updated. I stayed in an upper floor room with a nice view, but the couch was ridiculously uncomfortable to sit on. The "dream" sleeper sofa bed was literally taped together with duct tape and when you sat on the cushions you literally sank into the sleeper bed. The desk area and the rest of the furnishings were not placed in the room in the best manner. Closet doors could have used some painting and the refrigerator door stuck and hadn't been cleaned in a while. The work desk and chair were old and there were strange sort of disgusting things stuck to the chair. I had wireless issues that required calling the wireless services' help desk. The sliding pocket door between the toilet/shower area and the dressing area stuck every time you went in and out and and was SO annoying. Several times a day I heard strange noises in the walls that sounded like a very large cow mooing (old pipes maybe). Pulling up the first night at the "main" entrance, I had valet running to the car to help but when I told them I wasn't valet parking, they backed away, didn't offer a cart or a hand to unload the car. All in all, location was close to my office, but it was not the the most comfortable room I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when you are in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several weeks on business. Stayed in some other hotels in San Diego as well but this one was the best because the service is impeccable. The staff is excellent. They really know how to take care of their customers. Kudos to Umit Corut, Abdi, Lauren Prescott, Kevin Leavitt, Eddie Medina, Gilberto Lopez, Eusebio Torrales, Cara, Sasha and Zac for taking care of me. The staff here is fantastic. They know customers have a choice and they make sure that their customers will always choose to come back. I'll be back whenever I have to come to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay..”
Reviews.Author: Enzo L
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, and it was just, ok. One thing we hated was the parking. It got old very quick as we were coming and going several times during our sight seeing and dinner engagements. Going up the ramp for 7 floors, then going around to the 11th floor. Ugh. Not really their fault though. San Diego doesn't have a big luxury of parking space. The Room was not what I expected. Our expensive candy basket had open packages in it, the mini bar was out of order, the carpet was dirty, and the windows were dirty. We were on the 19th floor, so we cleaned our windows so we could look out. The bed was SUPREME as far as that goes, but the top comforter was dirty, with what looked to be chocolate smears. (very little, but noticeable on a white comforter). I sure hope it was chocolate. Then, went to jump on the internet on my lap top to explore options for things to do. $11 a day for that ? really ? Motel 6 offers free internet in each room. $23 for parking ? disappointing. Nothing great here. The staff really didn't seem to care, as we waited for a couple of minutes as they finished their conversation. (maybe training?)...anyway, for the price I paid, there are a number of places that I will consider next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: LoriRfromCali
Reviews.Content: We were pleasntly suprised by this property the room was amazing, clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was the bed was as hard as a rock, we generally perfer a firm mattress but this was like sleeping on the floor. Otherwise the room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes you feel 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: AnneMarieGigi
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the staff. Service with sincerity. Parking was a challenge but the rooms are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “FAB-ulous!”
Reviews.Author: SaoirseCOS
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego working and needed to be closer to work and collegues, inspite of being very full, the folks at Sheraton on A Street got me in. AND got me into a wonderful suite. The bed was amazing, it was clean, comfortable, good view and everyone was so nice and made me feel like I was home. The food in the restaurant was good and room service was WONDERFUL!!! Wow, Sheraton, for my first stay ever.........YOU MAKE ME WANT TO RUSH BACK! Thank you! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: wOrldTrav39
Reviews.Content: We just want to say that we were very impressed with all of the staff. Everyone we dealt with was so friendly and professional. The hotel is obviously well managed and the staff reflect this. Thanks for a great stay. We will be back. It is a convenient location. Driving up to the 11th level of the parking garage could be a problem for some, especially if you have to take your car out during your stay. It is a unique hotel since it starts on the 12th floor but we do not see that as a problem..We encountered noisey neighbors on Saturday night and we were assured by the front desk that if the problem continued they would do something to remedy it. Thankfully it subsided so we really don't know what they would have done. All in all a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable two nights stay”
Reviews.Author: pxb123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights here during a trip around California. Very friendly and attentive staff members. Only a couple of minor drawbacks. Internet hookup was confusing and had to call for assistance a couple of times. Very noisy neighbours as well but ceased upon a call to the front desk. All in all an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always Good!”
Reviews.Author: cdepks
Reviews.Content: I have been to America's Finest City many many times. I have also stayed and many different hotels downtown, but I always seem to come back to Sheraton Suites Symphony Hall. The fact that the hotel starts on a higher floor is just different, not a problem. The suites are very comfortable (I have been here with both my family and alone). Everything you can want is within walking distance. Petco Park, Gaslamp District, Harbor attractions, etc. Staff is very welcoming and friendly. Restaurant is good, nice comfortable bar area and if you are SPG (certain level, I am not sure what), there is a nightly reception room with free drinks and snacks...can't wait till my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, convenient upscale all-suites hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BruinDan
Reviews.Content: This is a higher-end property located in the financial district of downtown San Diego that has an appeal to both business and leisure travelers. Its location â€“ very near the offices of numerous large banks and corporations â€“ is ideal for the business traveler, while leisure travelers should appreciate the spacious, comfortable suites. Tourists should note that the biggest downside of this hotel may be convenience â€“ the only attractions within easy walking distance from here are the Gaslamp Quarter and Horton Plaza, both of which are about a half-mile (0.8 km) away. I stay at this property on business at least once per quarter and have noticed that the staff executes consistently well. The service is cordial and efficient, and the suites are tidy and kept in good repair. One of the ironies of this hotel (and other upscale downtown hotels) is that even though your room rate is higher, nothing is free â€“ thereâ€™s no free breakfast, no free parking and no free Internet access. Theyâ€™re all available to you, but you have to pay for them. Still, if you can afford it (or if youâ€™re on an expense account), this is a well-run property that will enable you to rest easy.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: justtandy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and pretty, but the suite was smaller than average room usually is. the furniture was forced in there to accommodate the words SUITE. The bed room doors didn't close because the beds were to big and in the way. Although the advertise flat screen TV's its really only a Flat screen in living area, the old bulky TV in the room was so tiny you could only watch from one bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty room in a Hotel that didnt care”
Reviews.Author: Rus B
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with one sentence. Old pubic hair in the shower! GROSS!! Someone left a smeared....Face?? on the sliding glass door. Plugged the iron in to a non working outlet, had to iron in the bathroom, the phone didnt work, I couldnt find the remote the entire time there and the bathroom was stocked with a 1/3 of a roll of toilet paper. They took a $100.00 deposit which they have since held on to for a week (my stay was two days) and I never dared use the mini bar after experiencing the rest of the room. My suggestion, take your blacklight with you or book the Marriot down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Stacyawilkinson
Reviews.Content: We just checked into the Sheraton suite and already want to leave. We purchased what we thought was a "deal" on Priceline only to discover that between parking and the "free" wifi our reasonable rate just doubled!! The hotel has said that the issue is pricelines alone and will not have any flexibility or an appearance of service. In addition the room has tears in the carpet, a miniscule tub and thin walls(im listening to someone take a shower as i am writing this review). It is certainly laking in the ammenities I would have expected from Sheraton I can't help feeling like this supposed 3.5 star hotel is actually a 1 star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: sunshinebeach2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night right before Christmas. This is a great location if you want to be in downtown financial district. There is a choice to park yourself for $23 or valet for $30. We took valet because we didn't want to deal with taking our car in and out and didn't worry about an extra $7. Check-in process was super easy and front desk clerks were very nice. I am a gold SPG member so I should be automatically upgraded even though I only paid $109 for the night. They didn't have any upgraded rooms available so they offered to put us on a higher floor. Room was fine but smelled a bit musty. Went back down to front desk to see if there was another room available. Same clerk helped us and was very accomodating. We moved to the hypo-allergenic floor and the room smelled much better. The size of the room was very comfortable for a family of 4. It was nice to have 2 full size beds and the sofa sleeper as well as 2 TVs. We went swimming in the indoor pool. It smelled very strongly of chlorine which got to me after 10 minutes or so. We also noticed that at both the pool and the spa that a cover over the drain on the ouside wall was loose. Seemed like it could be a safety hazard if it was stepped on so we stayed away from it. We ate at the bar and the food was fine although the service was slow at 3:00 in the afternoon. Spent $40 on 2 appetizers and 2 sodas. Not a great price but very convenient before heading out for the night. We loved being in the downtown area within walking distance to the gaslamp district. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpfull staff, nice views, large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: skyserf
Reviews.Content: I stay here maybe 7-8 times a year, maybe more. I like the large rooms. The layout is not like a typical hotel room. I've always found the staff to be helpful. And there are nice views of the city. The approach to runway 27 at SAN airport is just a few miles away but it's hard to discern the noise from the aircraft. I did find an empty condom wrapper on the box spring when I went looking for a power outlet behind a lamp.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Comfortable, Quiet, and Large Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kevman123
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites San Diego was a last minute reservation for us on a family trip to San Diego and LA. We were pleasantly surprised with the size of the rooms and loved the separate living area. Pros: Very Large Rooms â€“ especially for downtown San Diego Separate living area with sofa sleeper Very Quiet Great views of downtown San Diego and Airport (if you like watching planes) TV in Living Room and Bedroom Cons: This property is starting to show its age. While it is well maintained, the fixtures (especially shower) are dated. You have to take two separate elevators to get from your room to the street.

Reviews.Title: “room felt in need of update”
Reviews.Author: frank r
Reviews.Content: the wallpaper was coming loose in several places and the seats in the room had stuffing coming through. made the room feel old and dirty. if it were not the Christmas spirit in me, I would have cancelled and gone to another hotel with my wife. i would not plan on staying there in the future or recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Average with great bar area”
Reviews.Author: Mvated
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with and enjoyed the area although a little seedy at night. Beds were comfortable and living room was extremely cramped with the tv strangely positioned by the rooms door. First morning the shower didn't work! It just dripped water!! How could nobody have noticed this??? Engineer came right up but took 40 min to fix and we had to run shower-less. Zack and Shasha in the bar were awesome!!! We stopped by to see them every evening and really put a positive spin on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice from the outside, and their lobby, restaurant, and bar are impressive. However, once you get into the room it was another story. We paid close to $200 since we got the PURE room. So you would think it would be even extra clean and nice. The sink knob was missing a bolt, the shower head had what looked like years of hard water build up and rust. We found a fake eye lash on a new towel! For the amount we paid, I would expect better than that. I could have got this type of room staying at a Motel 6. In fact, I believe that the decor at the Holiday Inn Express was more updated than that in this hotel. Maybe I got unlucky and just got a dirty room. Maybe I should have complained and insisted on switching rooms. However, I came with my family to spend the weekend at Sea World, Zoo, and Safari, therefore, all I wanted to do was sleep and get out of there. Is it too much to ask for a clean and maintained room?

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Tuesday - Friday, used self and valet parking. Everything was just okay, not spectacular, not bad. Minor complaints but they added up to general dissatisfaction. Pros: -Comfortable bed with nice comforter and sheets -Quiet room -Suite with french doors to close off the bedroom from the sitting room -Sink area located outside the bathroom -Good water pressure for shower Neutrals: -Pillows were just okay, but large and plentiful Cons: -No tissue in room when we arrived -Minibar fridge out of order -Ugly pipe under sink needs to be painted or covered -Stains on carpet -Twice did not receive wake up calls as requested! -Couldn't find valet to retreive my car one morning, had to call front desk, they called the valet stand where I was currently standing! I answered the phone and confirmed there was no valet at the stand so they paged him by radio and he finally appeared. -Used the decaf and was not left anymore the next day, wrote a note to ask for more from housekeeping, got 2 the next day -Used glasses were not replaced with clean ones the next day so from then on I left them in the sink and they got replaced -No shelves in the shower on which to place toiletries -Two light bulbs were out over the vanity and never got replaced during our stay -I can't swear that the heater was working, it seemed to only blow cold air, I could be wrong Overall it was disappointing and I would not stay there again given so many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Sheraton Symphony Hall!”
Reviews.Author: horn2tr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times and were not disappointed this time either. It's nice to have a bigger than the average hotel room and the touches are nice, although the hotel is beginning to show it's age. A bit of updating and repairs might be needed. It was clean and we had a nice view of San Diego. Plan to stay again. Used the gym and it was fine, will use the pool and jacuzzi next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, rooms are comfy but worn”
Reviews.Author: mathTeach314
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in a week: once for a pre-conference getaway with my husband and once for a conference. Pros: excellent service; comfy room (loved the couch!); great views, and overall pretty well appointed; great robes (if you get a new one); great access to the local train. Cons: room is very worn, especially around the shower the drawers in the bedroom, which were falling apart; old-school tube TV in the bedroom, so when I switched from the OFF in the LR, the picture quality looked all the more worse; the only gave *one* robe in the club rooms, so my husband and I didn't get our own...WTH? Finally, I hate the Sheraton gives you glass drinking glasses in the living room, but plastic in the bathroom. Be consistent! Last comment: after you check out, if the send you a survey about your stay, don't bother doing it. They sent one to me and I shared all my comments above and I haven't heard one peep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastick room”
Reviews.Author: palmspringsdoug
Reviews.Content: You will receive a GREAT room, complete with wonderful views, a living room, little bar, beautiful doors to the bedroom and a great bathroom. It is a WONDRFUL room in a great location. I would highly recommend planning an extra $30 a night for parking unless you are comfortable with a meter where you have to move the car early. Don't do self park for $23, the drive up to self parking is a long windy one. Also enjoyed the little gym and pool, though no steam or sauna. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. The beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: thesisgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Symphony Suites for one night and was pleasantly surprised by the size and comfort of the room. The room had a livingroom area with a counter for microwaver, coffee maker, small fridge and french doors which opened to a very comfortable king size bed. There was a shower stall and separate tub. I was eligible for a free glass of wine and breakfast in the a.m. which was in a dining area/lounge on the 12floor beside the front desk. The feeling is similar to staying in apartment building. The check in was fast and efficient and the young lady was very welcoming. While reviewing work related reading I relaxed in the lounge with my free glass of wine and ordered a hummus and dip tray. The server/bartender certainly had a knack for making everyone feel at home and chatted with several of the patrons. For a female staying alone I found the location a bit off the beaten path and has there are several homeless living on streets in the downtown area I opted for a short cab drive to the convention centre but also walked it in about 15 minutes. I rated the room only a 4 as it was a bit dated with wallpaper and older chesterfield but was still better than average. Bed was excellent comfort with nice white linens and duvet. I found the room on the 21st floor exceptionally quiet.

Reviews.Title: “An unusual location”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on top of a very weird parking garage and the entrance is on the 12th floor. The hotel lobby starts on the 12the floor. The parking process is very odd and expensive which does not show in their spg listing but otherwise the property was nice and the pool and fitness center was quite nice. Beautiful views from the room. Bed was very comofrtable.

Reviews.Title: “Good suites hotel, except housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Asdfg1234
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms for 3 nights. Both rooms were comfortable & well appointed, concierge services were friendly & knowledgeable, valet services were courteous & efficient. Convenient location to Balboa Park, Gaslamp district & freeways. Wished that housekeeping was better. Carpets were not vacuumed adequately, empty water bottles from the previous guests were never taken away, used beverage glasses were left by the door, bathroom was not dusted, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Beachtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times now and will continue to return for both business or vacation. I have been for work once but returned for vacation twice to this hotel and couldn't have been happier all 3 times. Customer service is what keeps me coming back. The location is great and is walking distance to downtown. Some may say it is a bit of a walk but I think its very enjoyable. Many eateries close by if you don't want to stray to far. Not sure about talking small kids but teens would be fine. Personally I think the attitude you go with detemines much of what your experience will be. This hotel has nice size rooms, good prices, nice bar/restaurant and nice views, not much more you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable customer service - above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in North America and around the world. While I have experienced a range of service, the staff at the Sheraton Suites in San Diego are the cream of the crop. From personally delivering a package (to save me the cost) to searching out egg nog, the service was amazing. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: stanmcd
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but not overly impressive. You first have to take the street level elevator to the 12th floor to Reception. Then another elevator to your room. Clean. Maybe some decent views if you are on the right side of the building. Not a lot to do in the immediate area. A short walk to the Gaslamp District or $8 cab ride. Not convenient as hotels closer to downtown or the Marina district.

Reviews.Title: “Hair ball and mildew in shower”
Reviews.Author: Nick E
Reviews.Content: For $180/night I would have thought that we could have avoided the big black hair ball and black mildew in the shower. I guess not. When I brought the hair ball and mildew that I brushed from the shower to the manager, he simply offered a free breakfast....a free breakfast?!? for sleeping in a room with black mildew and black hair balls on the floor? be careful of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: nellipuzha
Reviews.Content: Best part about this hotel is that it is very conveniently located in Downtown San Francisco. But, I was a bit disappointed with the amenities and mostly with the breakfast. I have found better and more varied choices for breakfast at other hotels. Say Hyatt. But, the Club Rooms that we stayed were extremely nice and had a separate living area from the bedroom. Marina and Gas Lamp Quarter are just a short (read 10 min and 15 mins) walk away. Parking is paid at this hotel. At USD 30, you might want to consider whether you want to drive in.

Reviews.Title: “NDC - ED300 Certification Course/Exam”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Sheraton Suites at Symphony Hall San Diego was outstanding to say the least!! I was greeted by a first-class group of staff members who treated me like royalty! They were friendly, courteous and very helpful in accomodating my travel needs. One staff member, Ms. Teresa, made sure that my stay, as a Starwood Preferred Guest of the Sheraton Suites, lived up to its standard of being a Five-Star hotel and my hat is off to her!! The room was top notch and the bed made me feel like a "queen"!! Other amenities of the hotel (i.e. pool, restaurants, location from shopping, etc.) were excellent as well! All and all, I look forward to my next stay at this Sheraton Suites very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Downtown Area and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Suites San Diego for 3 nights. This high rise hotel is located above the San Diego Symphony Hall in the downtown area just a few minutes walk from the Gaslamp District. The lobby / front office is located on the 12th floor of the hotel. A restaurant and bar are located adjacent to the lobby along with several meeting rooms, a pool, and a gym that are located on the same floor. A friendly front office associate promptly checked me in and welcomed me to the hotel. He was kind enough to ask me if I needed any maps, recommendations on places to see, or dining recommendations for the area. I was assigned a room on the 25th floor overlooking Balboa Park and the airport. The room was spacious with a nice lounge area with flat screen TV and bar service area (with sink) that also included a microwave oven. Adjacent to the lounge was a work area with a desk and Internet connection. Internet service was offered at an extra charge. The bedroom was located behind a set of French doors adjacent to the lounge area. There was a standard tube TV in the bedroom. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was divided into two separate rooms. There was a sink and large closet in the first room. A toilet, bathtub and separate shower stall were in the second room. With the exception of some stains on the carpet in the bedroom and small patches of mildew on the caulking in the bathroom and some spotty, poorly applied, caulking around the shower stall, the entire room appeared clean and well maintained. The furniture in the room was standard hotel furniture, maybe even a little â€œupscaleâ€� for hotel furniture, with some pieces that were due for replacement due to having numerous scratches. Over my three day stay at the hotel I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant each morning. The restaurant offers a nice buffet with hot and cold selections but I decided to order from the menu as the buffet was simply too much food for breakfast. All of the staff I encountered in the restaurant were welcoming and provided prompt and courteous service. The food I ordered was tasty and of good quality and was served to me within a reasonable period of time. Overall, I found this hotel offers a quality hard and soft product with the soft product accentuated by the hotelâ€™s quality staff. Unfortunately, I did not have my camera with me during this trip but the photos posted by others here on Trip Advisor accurately depict the room in which I stayed. GETTING THERE If you are arriving by plane and donâ€™t mind taking public transportation, metro bus #992 can take you to and from the airport directly into downtown for just $2.25 each way. There are bus stops just outside each of the terminals at the airport. Disembark at Broadway and 8th Streets which is about a 15-20 minute ride from the airport depending on the time of day and traffic conditions. Walk back to 7th Street, turn right, and walk north (up the slight hill) for three blocks to â€œAâ€� Street then turn right. The entrance to the hotel is mid-block. If you arrive by train, the hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk, east on Broadway (turn left on Broadway after exiting the train station), then left on 7th Street to "A" Street. You can also catch the #992 airport bus on Broadway, either the Orange Line trolley towards Gillespie Field or the Blue Line trolley towards San Ysidro (disembark at 5th Street), or catch a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: skydoc101
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel is kind of a hole the in wall with an elevator to the 12th floor lobby. (the first twelve floors are symphony hall in case you are in town on a concert weekend) We like to have two room suites so that one of us can get up in the night to read and Sheraton Suites delivered nicely. Check your room rate a few days prior to visiting. Ours had gone down $60, which the clerks reluctantly, but pleasantly agreed to honor. It is worth the free upgrade by being a preferred member, but probably not worth the $40 per day to the Club floor. The room was spacious and the bed comfy. There was a separate tub and shower. The tub faucet had a continuous leak...tink..tink..tink. The couch sagged a bit and being dark blue cloth, there were bits of lint on the surface. There was a piece of wrapper trash on the carpet. And the mini bar refrigerator ran continuously. The latter was fixed by having room service turn it off...hope they remembered to turn it back on. These were all minor flaws and I mention them just for completeness. Fitness equipment was very basic-one bike, two treadmills and a small universal gym. Pool/spa looked clean. The breakfast was complete including made to order omelets, yogurt, breads, fruit, and cereal. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Marine Families! Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: indigo
Reviews.Content: While the hotel property is not state-of-the-art, the staff here more than makes up for that in terms of helpfulness and courtesy. And honestly, after traveling from Texas to see my son's Marine graduation, that was much more valuable than schmancy-nancy digs. From the doormen to the guest services desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone was respectful, kind and so willing to go the extra mile to make sure this event went well for us, as well as enjoy our stay in San Diego as we picked out places to visit afterwards. They even recommended little inexpensive eateries that helped us stay within our budget. (Check out the Pizza and Subs place down the street from the hotel by the way - the owner, Jason, is a stand-up guy, and makes a great pie!) And kudos to the SATO Travel Agent Kristin who recommended staying here so we could be sure to be close to the action in the Gaslamp District. Sure, it's a little distance from the MCRD, but it's not much in cab fare, and there was a van that took us out on graduation day (and the driver even waited around to make sure everyone got a ride back). The room was a deal, and the two double queen beds and the sofa bed in the suite area made sure no one had to bunk on the floor

Reviews.Title: “Quite underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Emiliano M
Reviews.Content: I checked in late night and pulled up to valet. No one else was around and the valet greeted me and just stared at my car I had to request a receipt ticket for my car. The valet seemed a little confused by my request but complied. I arrived at the front desk and there was one person in front of me and only one attendant at the front desk. I had to wait for a good 10 minutes for the very meticolous explanations given to the person checking in and when it was finally my turn someone showed up from the back office; needless to say I didn't receive the same attention. I'm a Starwood preferred customer and got an upgrade to my room. The room had stains on the carpet and a funky smell. The air conditioning unit was emitting a smell of sewage that made it impossible for me to sleep. Granted I come to Las Vegas and parking is free for us but getting charged for $30 for the following valet service was quite an insult: I checked in at around 10pm and checked out around 9am, so this made it about $3/hr. I called in advance to have my car ready at valet and the car was there; when I loaded the car I saw a valet looking at me so I showed my ticket and said that was my car and that I was just looking for the keys. Three different people started to scramble around saying they couldn't find them. After waiting about 15 minutes it turned out that the original valet I talked to, had them in his pocket....safe to say I won't return or recommed this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: indieblogher
Reviews.Content: This is an wonderful hotel with an excellent location in downtown San Diego. I appreciated it being somewhat off the beaten path with the collection of other hotels in the area. This made for a quieter visit, greater attention from the staff and a more relaxing environment. All the while allowing access to public transportation, Balboa Park, The San Diego Zoo, Little Italy, and surrounding tourist attractions. The staff was extremely helpful; from doorman/concierge to the front desk to the restaurant to the bar to housekeeping. The breakfast was delicious and offered a nice selection of choices. The Club Level Room was a welcome amenity after a long day. I will definitely add this to my list of must stays in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Devin E
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at the Sheraton and will be returning in the future. The staff was very professional and the rooms were very well kept. I highly recommend the hotel and will be returning in the future. I stayed on the 27th floor and the view was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly -- good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: texan123Austin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on the recommendation of one of my colleagues. Was upgraded to club level and breakfast was excellent. room was quiiet and staff very friendly. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Karenrain
Reviews.Content: I used the valet option which was quick and easy but expensive ($30/day). I was able to check in on time (4pm). I had a room with a king-sized bed and it was nicer than I imagined! There was a living room with a couch, chair, desk, and flat screen TV; then a separate bedroom with a large bed and a tube TV. There were doors that could close to shut off the bedroom from the living room area. The bathroom had separate tub and shower. The sink is separate from the bathroom (which I like in a hotel). The rooms are not equipped with wireless -- you have to plug in at the desk ($10/day). I suppose my biggest problem with the room were stains on the comforter and another blanket -- one stain looked like chocolate, the other like blood. I'm sure the blankets were clean (since the whole room was immaculate when I checked in) but I think there should be a point if there is a noticeable stain, the blankets get tossed (which, of course, may be impractical from a business stand point). I used the heated pool (80 degrees) and the hot tub on the 12th floor. There is a skylight so I was able to watch the sunset from the hot tub -- very relaxing. Room service is so-so. It came on time and the person who delivered the food was very professional but the food itself is something I could've ordered at a Denny's for a lot less. They charge $3.50 for room delivery and add an extra 21% for gratuity. If you decline housekeeping, you receive a $5 voucher to be used at the gift shop. However, I found the gift shop lacking. It promised reading material but consisted of just a few obscure magazines. But if you're looking for cheaper soda than the vending machines, this might be the place. The location was great -- just a 10- to 15-minute walk to Horton Plaza. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room with mold and wet carpet.”
Reviews.Author: KaseyWasey
Reviews.Content: Check in is at 3pm but since our flight came in at 11am we asked in advance if we could check in early. They couldnt promise anything but not only were we not allowed to check in early, we weren't allowed to check in on time either. Apparently a "preferred guest" was staying in our room before us and they have the option to check out at 4pm.We weren't given our room until 4:45 and it was FILTHY!There was black mold in the air vent, red stains on the ground,a soaked wet spot in the living room and brown stains on the lamp shade.It also smelled like old cigarettes.We called and complained and all they did was send house keeping up to spray a fragrance to cover up the smell.Then they justified why the floor was wet saying that the people before us spilled coffee and they had to clean it.We waited for an entire hour in this dirty room for them to finally find us a different room to move in to. When we moved in to the new room we knew they went in ahead of us and sprayed their fragrance cover up spray just in case...it smelled like cheap Fabreeze. If we weren't there for a family wedding I would have taken my family to a different hotel.I got the cleanliness of a Motel6 room that hadn't been cleaned and paid the price of a Penthouse in Vegas. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Basic Amenities In SD; Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: gt_a_lif
Reviews.Content: A quick business trip to San Diego and I decided to stay here. The front steps are a little confusing to roll your luggage since the flat part is at the far end, ask the cabbie to leave you there. The lobby is on the 12th floor, two elevators from the street to the lobby. Lobby has a couple of sofas to meet people and the Sheraton Link has a few stations. Wireless is available in the lobby. Front desk staff can be very good or not so good depending on who checks you in. Three elevators to the floors above. Rooms have 2 queens or a king. The rooms with the queens have a smaller sitting room than the king sized configuration. Suites have a couch, a couple of chairs, nice HD TV, desk and chair. Furniture looks recently redone but still Ozzie and Harriet modern, not bad but not SoCal style, more Upper Peninsula Michigan. Desk is basic, almost looks like they bought from a second hand repo company and the chair is comfortable but I could not figure out how to make the back recline (my fault probably versus the chair). Great news is they have a zip strip on the desk so outlets are not an issue. Downside is no wireless in the room so you need to sit at the desk to use the internet, câ€™mon it is 2011. Lots of lights and they are needed since the living area is not well lit through the windows. Bed is outstandingly comfortable; highlight of the room, and that is a good thing. A 5-8 year old TV is also in the bedroom area. Bathroom exceptionally clean, thank you, six mini-bottles of soaps and stuff. Looks like they just re-did and used Restoration Hardware, all clean lines and much more modern than other room. This Sheraton believes in the 2-towel approach so if you need more ask on arrival. Tub and a separate stall shower but be aware that the stall shower is about 2-feet by 2-feet, i.e. teenie-tiny. Decent water pressure and I was on the top floor. Ate lunch in the Restaurant, I would say lousy to fair at best, almost an in-house version of a low end chain restaurant. Chicken Quesadilla was a combination of processed stuff, not sure I would eat there, walk 1 block down the hill to 6th St for same low quality for half the price. TV check out works fine. Overall an OK place, nothing special, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service. Clean, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: yleecoyote
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a conference I attended. Both the accomadations and conference facilities were excellent. The staff were friendly and went above and beyond to make our stay a good one. Conceirge extremely helpful. Even found us a space to store a couple bikes we used to get around town. I'd stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good View”
Reviews.Author: rmarquez99
Reviews.Content: This hotel by far is one of the best hotels in downtown San Diego. The upside of the hotel is both the fact that it is an all suite hotel and that it is a Starwood Preferred Guest category 3, which means cheaper if bought with points. Views are nice, but don't expect views of downtown San Diego. The only views the hotel offers is of the airport and of Balboa Park, but its better than facing a wall. The price for self park is $24. The self parking entrance is very narrow and I drive a Prius.

Reviews.Title: “Linda at Front Desk was THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: ThomasWW
Reviews.Content: Thank You to Linda for going the extra step in finding out what happened to my reservation that mysteriously vanished!!! The reservation was shown as booked on my laptop but not at Sheraton. She checked and checked and even called Starwood to investigate. No Luck. All of this occurred at 3am in the morning and I was tired! Linda apologized for the inconvenience and compensated accordingly, without any hesitation. Yaaay, Linda!

Reviews.Title: “not good enough service”
Reviews.Author: barbara g
Reviews.Content: no pens, in the room... front desk and waited in restaurant unhelpful in optaining a piece of fruit

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer service”
Reviews.Author: parisrach
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was very accommodating to our needs; from the front desk, to the conceirge, to the maintenance person, etc. Our air conditioner was not working. Help was there within a few minutes and situation was resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome, Awesome”
Reviews.Author: terrdaly
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to any and everyone. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and both times the hotel and staff was top notch. The staff is professional, courteous and extremely helpful. If you have to decide between this hotel an another don't even consider the other. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kt012885
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. We stayed in a King Suite and it was awesome! A lot of people complained about the parking but honestly it wasn't that bad. It was pretty narrow but it really didn't take to much time. We payed 23.00 to park ourselves or you could do 30.00 valet. We opted for the cheaper just bc our trip was getting rather expensive. Service was great, wonderful view of the city!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christina H
Reviews.Content: We had an wonderful stay at this hotel, very clean and excellent service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...once you FINALLY arrive at your room”
Reviews.Author: ThinRock
Reviews.Content: We came to town for a wedding and were part of a large group. We researched and got what I think was a very good rate, so expected that they might stick us in a less desirable room as often happens. Not the case. We got an excellent corner room on a high floor without even making a request. Great view towards Balboa Park and the ocean. Very comfortable, well lit standard suite room. Bed was "heavenly" as they say, and the air con worked very well and was quiet. No noise from other rooms. The only negative was that the TV remote was very temperamental and required you to be within 3 feet of the TV to work...sort of. Aside from all that, one of the very best things about the hotel was the staff. So pleasant and responsive... and i mean everyone. They were just great across the board. Front Desk, Concierge, Valet Parking. Someone has done some good training with these folks. The worse thing about the place is the two elevator journey to the room from the parking garage. Not a big deal, just a little inconvenience. All in All, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot - skip the car and explore by foot”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as part of a quick trip to the area. The immediate area is a little on the quiet side, but the Gaslamp District and Petco Park are a very easy walk of 10 to 15 minutes. If you are going to a Padres game and/or spending the day in the city, there is no need for a car - I picked up a car the next day, cutting a lot off of the cost of car rental and parking. Tons of spots for food and drink in the area - good happy hours, primarily 4 to 7 or so, but keep a lookout for earlier starts and some late-night specials. Hotel is clean, comfortable, and well-furnished. Wifi is an added cost ($11 or so). Restaurant/lounge in lobby has a Happy Hour - but it was only from 4 to 6, so I'd go elsewhere. The area seemed very safe, though as others have noted there were a few homeless folks around (they did not bother me). Trolley system is close by ($5 gets you unlimited rides for the day). Overall, a very good spot and a good value with terrific employees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but dated”
Reviews.Author: Woogieworld
Reviews.Content: This was a top of the line hotel....about 15 years ago. Good location, close to everything, parking is $30 so plan accordingly. Small pool and hot tub. Nice staff, but this is a better hotel for business and not for taking the kids to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Parking problems”
Reviews.Author: maurmo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in downtown location. Trolley system 3 blocks away....harbor short drive. 2 small rooms suite with pull out couch, able to sleep 6 in tight quarters. We did a hotwire rate and then had to add on $27 night for parking.....didn't do it but put a damper on the trip for hubby to run around and move car to save $$$. No fridge but coffee maker and microwave. Not really for budget family travelers. Pool area really small.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Voyagian
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was more positive than som other reviews here. First you have to drive up 11 floors to park the car. Check-in went smoothly. My room was clean and had a wonderful view. Internet is free at the lobby. The swimming pool is too small. Otherwise we like the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could've been better.. front staff not helpful at all.”
Reviews.Author: Initiation
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for Comic Con 2011... we paid $302 a night after taxes, which is hard to swallow considering this hotel normally commands around $129+taxes/nt, and I see why. Located in the Downtown area, this hotel is close to a lot of restaurants and bars, as well as the mall.. however it is also rife with homeless. They are fairly non invasive compared to San Francisco, so that was a positive. Rooms were smallish and my room was not very clean (toenail clippings on floor, bathroom a bit dirty).. but it wasn't bad. Linens were fabulous, as was the water pressure in the bathroom. A lot of hotels have a noisy bathroom, this one does not! We were able to bathe and use the restroom at night without waking the others in the room. However --the bathroom does have the pull doors, so that can get clanky. You can decline housekeeping during your stay and receive a $5 voucher for the gift shop.. however be warned you have to put the placard about housekeeping on your door (small print). We declined housekeeping by leaving our do not disturb sign up 24/7 as we have done with other hotels and were denied our vouchers... when asked, the front desk staff were not able to verify if our room had been cleaned or not. Seemed like a gimmick to not pay out the vouchers. The front desk staff here are awful! We were booked for a club room floor, but were put on the 23rd floor instead. I had 3 people in my room, and was only given two keys and no breakfast vouchers... nor was I told about the Club Lounge or any other hotel amenities. I had to return to the front desk for my 3rd key and breakfast items. I inquired about checkout times and what time I had to have my car out of the parking garage on our last day, and could not get a straight answer. I would have appreciated being told about what elevators take you where in the hotel, as we had to figure out the elevator hopping by ourselves and it was very confusing for the first 2 days. I also was not given the shuttle information and maps provided by SDCC to the hotels to give to the guests... all the other hotels I visited in past years as well as stopped by in on this visit had their information prominently displayed. Breakfast (the buffet) was very respectable. Lots of cold and hot items, the orange juice and cottage cheese here are excellent (lots of places have yucky versions).. the wait staff was amazing. Very polite, helpful and quick to respond to your needs. The waitstaff was the best part of this hotel. Parking: It's not fun getting up to the 12th floor, but it's not the nightmarish corkscrew other reviews have said it to be. With that said, I never moved my car the 4 days we were here because it wasn't worth the hassle for me. In short... I wouldn't return unless the rate was $149/nt or less. The negative items outweighed the positives, and I've stayed in better hotels for less than the $300 we were charged. A lot of basic hotel procedures were skipped by the staff here, including being helpful and properly cleaning our room before our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BMG4ME
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum member and got a great welcome and upgrade from this hotel. This is certainly my preferred hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “An older hotel in the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: ICtravellers
Reviews.Content: Front Desk is located in the few floors up. Being in downtown, expect no parking available. Front desk staff that greeted us was very friendly. She shared with me the price matching policy that Sheraton had, knowing that I purchased the room from Expedia. The room was a bit older. The only pleasant surprise was upon check out, they had drinks in the lobby area. It was just ice water, but they threw in a little twist with sliced cucumbers. It was very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego trip”
Reviews.Author: Hazie013
Reviews.Content: WE stayed with our kids at the hotel and the room we were given was teeny. We ended uo getting another room to have some space but our plan completely backfired when the pluming woke us up at 4:30 in the morning!!!! It continued about every 15 to 20 min, we tried to call the front desk but our phones did not work. In either room! Needless to say we left the next morning. Not our best hotel experience:(

Reviews.Title: “We left early, not as promised. We won't come back.”
Reviews.Author: mcgeeg
Reviews.Content: I travel often and have stayed at Sheraton's before. I was promised a two bedroom suite that was really a one bedroom suite. The parking was dismal and dizzying at best. My kids said they were going to throw up and we weren't even half way up to the 11th floor parking lot. I ended up sleeping on the hide a bed since it wasn't the two bedroom suite I thought I was getting and had one of my worst nights of rest ever (better than many nights of my medical residency while being on call). To finish off my shortened stay, we ordered in room service and our order had three mistakes and we were forced into paying a gratuity already included in the bill. Sheraton should let this hotel go. It may have sounded like a good idea when they decided to build it, but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Kpstls
Reviews.Content: Overall very good stay. Two things though, one is no wifi in rooms. No good, need wifi. These days so many have devices like iPad only way to connect is wifi. Second problem we had, one day our room was not cleaned. We had been in room that morning till about 10 with do not disturb sign, but left at 10 and removed sign. Dissappointing to come back after a long day and no clean towels etc... Other than these two things we found the staff amazing! The breakfast was great. When our room was cleaned it was really a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: rewqasdcx
Reviews.Content: I would rate the facilities a 3.5 star and the service a 2 star. The hotel room was comfortable. The suite had one LCD TV, the other an old tube type TV with very poor resolution. The shower floor was stained and unpleasant to look at. Every time the bath was drained an unpleasant odor came out of the sink. The service was quite poor. The concierge were not knowledgeable nor helpful in any regard. The front desk was a little better but not much. The valet was the type you would get at a 3 star restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Security & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: GMcD55
Reviews.Content: I satyed at the Sheraton on the Bay in San Diego for a week long business trip and decided to go downtown to get some groceries. When I returned with 10 bags of groceries there were not more carts left at the concierge desk. When Claudio Arreola, the security guard, saw me standing on the curb waiting for a free cart he promptly asked if he could help me carry the bags to my room. Everyone at this hotel has been so friendly and helpful during the stay. Top notch! Glen McDonald

Reviews.Title: “Did not appreciate the added charge to my card”
Reviews.Author: teribillings
Reviews.Content: I was charged for an upgrade that I was not aware of and the maid service was terible not even sure they changed the sheets!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel would not be my first choice.”
Reviews.Author: Gang412
Reviews.Content: Upon check in there were no cribs avail. The room did not come with a mini fridge as stated online, it was a mini bar that u couldnt store food in. We had to call and request a fridge. The wall paper was was out dated. There was also a tube tv in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “No Free Continental Breakfast with Club Level Lounge? Why Bother?”
Reviews.Author: NorCal_Explorer
Reviews.Content: We are on the Starwood Preferred Guest program. We thought we would try a different Sheraton this time around since we've been to the Sheraton Mission Valley. This Sheraton is much closer to downtown area and Balboa Park which has a lot to do including the San Diego Zoo. We were impressed with the general layout of this all-suite hotel, since we have a toddler. The separation of rooms is nice even though it did feel a bit cramped. We were upgraded to the Club Level floor (26th) with a view of the San Diego bay and convention center. Directly across was a high rise business building. Although I'm not sure how much different the rooms are because when we went to the Club Lounge, it was a weird setup. First it wasn't in the same area as the Club Level rooms, which seems to make more sense. Second, the amenities in the Club lounge was somewhat lacking even in comparison to the Mission Valley location. At least there, you got to sit in a room that actually felt more like a lounge, they offered, a continental breakfast and also an afternoon wine and cheese. But not at this Sheraton Suites! It was actually quite awkward when I went into the lounge, you go past the restaurant then come around to your "private" entry. Once inside you see a sign that points to "breakfast buffet" thinking that this was part of the deal. Because we've been to Sheraton MIssion Valley where it is part of the deal at Club Level. I mean, what's the advantage of a club level room if there really isn't anything special about it? It does offer soda and coffee. But that's it. Very awkward conversation with the wait staff - who came down hard on me because I was getting a small carton of milk for my 2-year old son saying it wasn't part of the Club Lounge. Embarrassing and also confusing. Decent rooms- somewhat dated, quick check-in and checkout, courteous valet albeit the $30 charge. You pay for convenience. Location is easy access to the freeways. It is walking distance to gaslamp quarter and can find alternative dining experience nearby. Disappointed with club level lounge location and amenities. Will probably try other SD Starwood next time like the Westin on Broadway. We visit SD quite often so I am not convinced that this Sheraton is the "it" place for us with a kid in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelwhenican38
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a fabulous location. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Who rated this dump so well?”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: I don't stay at many Sheratons, however the ones I have stayed at have been outdated, including this one. The suite I had needed new paint and bathroom remodel. One TV was a flat screen and the other a big box old TV. Stay at Hotel Indigo for less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but not proximal to much.....”
Reviews.Author: nickiwms
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work and wanted to get something in a moderate price range. Liked the idea of sep bedroom as family was coming along so booked here. We did not have a car and i had a shuttle to the convention center which was convenient for me however, my family ended up cabbing it anywhere they needed to go as its location is not really near anything. the room was nice. nothing overly fancy but clean and spacious. there was a double entrance to the bathroom (with pocketdoors) and a living area and bedroom. I did note the shower to be really small and my 6'3'' husband did too! overall though, the room suited all our needs. there was a small indoor pool and workout area that was never crowded when we visited it. i too was disappointed that the internet required cat5 and you were charged for it. i did manage to get wifi from another hotel for free which i lucked out b/c i was facing a certain direction. this is a great place to stay for conventions if they provide a shuttle service but if you are vacationing here and want to be close to the action, i would not recommend... unless paying for parking offsets what you save in this more economical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “was happy”
Reviews.Author: michanrand
Reviews.Content: i was very happy with my stay here however,there is nothing conviently located and as woman traveling alone the homeless people everywhere were very scary. they approached me on a frequent basis trying to get money or ciggarettes. the staff of the hotel was outstanding however, my housekeeper spoke no english and was not able to understand that i needed a new coffee maker when asked and i had to look it up on google translator to inform her of my issue and she still did nothing with it. i didnt have cofee in my room two days in a row.also the creamer in the room was curdled so when i did make coffe it was spoiled by rotten creamer. my bed was not changed for the 4 days i stayed and on two of those days my room wasnt even cleaned. i have red hair and the black hair in my tub shower and on bathroom floor was GROSS! FRONT DESK STAFF WAS OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “I got robbed and the cops dont wont to do anything to assist me”
Reviews.Author: youngerrd
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice. The Breakfast area was fair. It was good food but $16 for buffett. They charge $23 a day for parking- this is a joke. They barely had any places to park the nights we stayed. They wanted to charge for the internet too $10 a day. Room rates $135 Parking $23 Internet $10 _ Free wifi if you wanted to wait in line down stairs. The purpose of a luxury stay is to relax in your room as much as possible not fight over a computer to use or pay for internet. No wifi in rooms either only Cat Cable Breakfast $16 w/o tip $20 w/tip I suggest dropping any internet fees. Lower Parking Fees to $15 and include a free intercon. breakfast which was not available unless you paid for a $200 room and at that rate you could just go to the buffett. I had to request fresh towels because the service failed to bring to the rooms. The Spa and Pool are to full to enjoy. It was a jugle of kids..

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: joycehendy
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I ws not offered and perk for being a gold starwood preferred member. No room up grade(ok not one was available). But no continental breakfast ??????????? I asked and was told every hotel does it differently which I understand, but this hotel did nothing. Not even a large free bottle of water in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable"”
Reviews.Author: Spygurl007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel one night last fall. we were in the area to visit the USS Midway. This hotel was very close to the museum and we got it on hotwire for $85. We had a very spacious one bedroom suite on one of the higher floors. It was very clean and modern with a some old world charm. We had a great view of the city, a little of the marina and we were on a flight path. My boyfriend loves aviation and we enjoyed watching the planes fly by. The windows must of been sound-proofed because we didn't hear any noise. Reception was very friendly and gave us a map and detailed instructions of attractions and what was available to do and see in the area. They treated us like celebrities and even took a picture of us in their beautiful lobby. The parking was kind of odd. we had to travel around and around up a narrow driveway to get to the top to park. All in all it was a great stay and I would not hesitate to stay there again. I honestly don't know how they got so many poor reviews. I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: amher1972
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites is the perfect place to stay to play, relax, and enjoy. The club level room had a wonderful view and was exceptionally appointed. We were able to walk to the PETCO stadium, and the Gaslamp district. Symphony Hall is right next door. The reception and valet staff were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Detailed Cleaning in Room!”
Reviews.Author: julu112005
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because the website stated that it has rooms with closed doors from the living room. I wanted this layout because I was planning to have guests visitors. The bathroom supposed to have two access entries. That wasn't the case at all. You had to go through the bedroom to get to the bathroom. The bathroom has a door that closed off the toilet and shower which is great but the sink area is faced with the closet. Very tight area. If I was to brush my teeth at the sink, the hubby wouldn't be able to get his stuff out of the closet! Very annoying. My chief disappointment is the cleanliness of the room. The double door that closed off the bedroom from the living room had blood stain of fingerprints on one of the doors! Disgusting! I didn't noticed this until we checked out. OMG, I wanted to vomit! There were other little things that didn't make me happy like the phone wasn't working properly, but the bloody finger print stain was unacceptable. The only thing positive about this hotel that I can say is the service. We requested a fridge for the room and we got it within 15 minutes. Oh, also, it was graduation week and there were tons of young high school or college kids, not sure, but they pretty much took over the hotel. The couple next to our room got into a fight in the middle of the night! I think they were one of the graduating kids. And, the parking machine (reader) wasn't working either! I will never return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: richthetraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week during a conference. Rooms were excellent and very clean. Service was great. Food was very tasty although a touch on the expensive side. Should have free wireless in the rooms, the wired access was an unexpected additional cost. Location was very convenient for the Gaslamp Quarter - Greystone's is highly recommended as is Fred's Mexican place.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Sheraton Suites”
Reviews.Author: tvlndream
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at this property was in 2005 and it was a wonderful then as much as it is now. The staff is friendly and very accomodating, we were upgraded to the club level which provided appitizers at 5pm and breakfast in the morning. The room was comfortable and love the suite sleeper bed. Close to everything downtown and the parking is only $23 for the night. The Sheraton Suites provides the bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “I've had better stays”
Reviews.Author: AKay25
Reviews.Content: It was very disapointing of this hotel to treat a long time customer with such poor service. Upon checkin, I was told that the key maker was broken and therefore I would have to be escorted to my room till they fixed their key maker. I waited around for 10 minutes for one of their key holders to come and take me to my room. 10 minutes...ok. I dealt with it even though I was extremely exhausted at this point (7pm) and having just gotten off work. I went, changed and decided to go to their gym to get a quick workout before bed. Well, a key was required to be allowed in the gym. I walked back to the front desk for assistance. Another 10 minutes to get an escort to the gym! Fine! Their gym was very disapointing. The weight machines were broken, missing parts, and didn't work right. Finished working out and wanted to go back up to my room. At this point is about 10pm and I just want to get in bed and get sleep. Still no key and need an escort again! 20 minutes to get an escort for one final time to my room?!!! Really?!!! In the morning the key maker is finally working. I got get a key and go to work. I get back to the hotel after another exhausting day at work (7pm) to find out my key does not work!!! Lucky for Sheraton I've had many good stays here therefore I think I can let this bad experience slide. I reported my dissapointment to the manager and all I got was an apology. No credit. No free stay. No nothing. I have a feeling if another hotel comes along with as competitive rates, I may just have to switch.

Reviews.Title: “Serious neglect of repairs”
Reviews.Author: Swansong84
Reviews.Content: Although the room was spacious and very clean, we encountered several items that needed repairs during our stay. We reported them, but no repairs were made - it did not appear the hotel had a repair staff. The bed was hard and sleep was poor all three nights. The breakfast buffet was delicious though and most of the hotel staff were very courteous and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: shimmers_07
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about your hotel. It was the first time we ever stayed at a Sheraton. We were going to a show at the House of Blues and the hotel was in a great location. The hotel made our stay a lot more enjoyable. I just wish we could have stayed for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “The concierge is my hero.”
Reviews.Author: JLW1972
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay. We had a bus of Kindergarteners at Symphony Hall when our bus was involved in a slight accident with another bus. Two buses of Kindergarteners on a warm San Diego day waiting for the police to arrive and write a report. The teachers took a few kids to the front who needed to use a restroom and the next thing we know the concierge (at least I would guess that's who he was) was outside with bottles of water and snacks for over 100 students. So, if you're looking for a place where the people are top-notch, I highly recommend the Sheraton at Symphony Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, noisy pipes”
Reviews.Author: NWILgal
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable, and I particularly enjoyed having a sitting area separate from the bedroom. The bed was comfortable enough, though the "fitted" sheet was an issue. The first night of our stay, the bottom sheet and the mattress pad pulled off the mattress. I remade the bed the next day, putting the mattress pad and the sheet on properly, and it worked well for two more nights. When I had the sheets changed, the "fitted" sheet became a flat sheet with a rough approximation of hospital corners. It was not terrible, but not nearly as comfortable as a fitted sheet would have been. The pipes in the building were very noisy. There was a lot of groaning, buzzing and vibration whenever water was being run in adjacent bathrooms. We got used to it, but we were glad that, for the most part, our neighbors kept roughly the same schedule we did. I would stay at this hotel again. Our housekeepers did a fine job, and everyone we encountered was very pleasant. We were guests at this hotel for almost a week, and I did not regret that we had chosen to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile to be Starwood guest member club level”
Reviews.Author: sunstate301
Reviews.Content: Room was upgrade to club level and the room is outstanding! Beds are comfortable and the service was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a Little Tired”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerDC52
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and the rate was good, but like many of the Sheratons around the country, this hotel is looking a little worn and dated. Carpets are fading, and the bathrooms are showing wear like many old bathrooms do. To be fair, the facilities are clean and offer the conveniences one would expect in a hotel geared toward business travelers. However, given the wide range of comparable hotels available in San Diego, this property would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and fabulous personnel. We won't stay any place else in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: kaycornell
Reviews.Content: Just great location! Lovely rooms! The rooms were clean with nice products and the staff was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: girlinmotion101
Reviews.Content: I liked this property. It is set up as two rooms living room/bedroom. I was alone but appreciated the additional space. This would really be excellent for families because of the space and pullout couch in the living room. It is also an excellent location. Close to the Gas Lamp and Hillcrest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, walking distance to restaurants, shopping and gaslamp district”
Reviews.Author: MarciG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the last 4 days of our trip. The hotel was very clean, quiet and well maintained. The lobby is on the located on the 12th floor of the hotel which was nice. Upon entering the lobby we were greeted right away and told that we were able to check in even though check in wasn't for a couple of hours. The lady at the counter was very friendly and helpful. We had a one bedroom suite that wasn't huge but definitely served it's purpose. It was very clean and modern. The bed was super comfortable and shower had a lot of water pressure. In the lobby they had quite a few computers available for guest use. We were able to check in for our flight and print off our boarding passes with no problems. The hotel is equipped with a gym and an indoor pool. The gym had 2 treadmills and 3 elliptical all of which were very modern and equipped with individual televisions. It also had a universal that was really nice. Some universals are awful but this one was new and fully functional. There is a restaurant as well as a little bar just past the lobby. We didn't eat in the restaurant but we did have some appetizers in the lounge. They had happy hour menu for both food and drinks. The prices were good, food was average. In all fairness we only had a couple of appetizers; the nachos which were really good and the hummus and the coconut shrimp both of which were average. Most other times we ate out. Karl Strauss is within walking distance and has fantastic food and a great selection of beer. We also ate on the patio at the Elephant & Castle across from the USS Intrepid. Really good food and a great place for people watching. The hotel is also within walking distance to the gas lamp district where they have tons of restaurants and a pretty big shopping centre. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The only complaint we did have was nothing that the hotel could control but a message to others who are staying in hotels. Please be mindful of your neighbors and try not to slam your doors :)

Reviews.Title: “My Sheraton reservation”
Reviews.Author: mbadalamente
Reviews.Content: Sir/Madam I booked my stay at the SD Sheraton Suites in 10/10. The purpose was business to attend an AAOS conference. Two days prior to the 2/16 arrival date I received an e mail that my reservation had been cancelled and I was to move to a Sheraton in La Jolla. The reason was hotel overbooking. The manager was "going to see" if anyone cancelled. This practice is totally UNACCEPTABLE. The reservation was ultimately restored at the SD location but only after hours upon hours of pleading with the hotel manager, who repeadedly questioned me as to whether I was a speaker at the AAOS conference ( I was). What do my business plans have to do with a hotel reservation made 4 months ago? The stay was very nice. Your reservations need to be honored.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if you can get a low rate.”
Reviews.Author: spacenuts
Reviews.Content: You've probably already heard the self-parking horror stories so I won't re-hash that. Traveling with young kids, we opted for $30/day valet for the convenience. Kudos to Keola for being super friendly and professional. Although not a traditional suite, the room does offer nearly double the space of a standard room. Room was very comfortable, bed and pillows excellent. No complaints with the bathroom. We requested a small refrigerator which was brought up promptly at no charge. Microwave and free starbucks coffee in room. Staff was pleasant throughout, from the front desk staff to the gift shop lady. Being in downtown San Diego, it was 10-20 minutes to everything (malls, Sea World, Zoo, etc). If we didn't get the special $99 rate, we probably would not have stayed here since parking is so expensive. However at $130/night (including parking), we thought the hotel was a good value for a suite.
