Reviews.Title: “Customer service was the worst I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: GDC77
Reviews.Content: As briefly as I can, I made a reservation, the CSR on the phone booked the wrong days. When I recieved the confirmation I called and was told by another CSR there was nothing he could do on the phone. He took my email and phone and said he emailed the manager and I would recieve a call to straighten it out. A week went by - no call. I arrived and checked in and mentioned my experience to the desk person who said " sorry about that " , a term I would hear several more times. The problem is, when you're sorry as a business, you generally do something to fix it, not just walk away like it is meaningless. I got checked in and was unpacking when I heard water pouring through my ceiling in the bathroom - through the light fixture etc. This actually was not a big deal to me - things break and accidents happen. A hotel employee came up and said they would move me in the morning - still no problem - then house cleaning came by and just walked in on me. No knock, nothing. when I said something she ignored me like I wasn't even there. She cleaned up the water and I didn't notice until morning she used all my towels and never brought any back. I dried off in the morning with a hand towel. The desk said "sorry about that". (no joke). I was then forced to check out and check back in, run my card again because they moved me and screwed up my reservation....really guys? This is not to mention sitting in the restaurant/bar for 40 minutes waiting for service. Everytime the waitress walked by I tried to get her attention and she just kept going. I finally found another person in the restaurant to help me. The up side...the food was very good. I waited to post this, to re-evaluate, but the thruth is the truth, and I would be embarrassed to run my business this way.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: VacationLvr001
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a couple of days at a conference. It was so nice to come back to relax in such a comfortable, clean room each day. I felt the room was very reasonably priced for it's location and for how nice the hotel was. Very classy! I had noticed that a number of other reviewers had commented regarding the parking structure, and I had actually expected it to be so much worse than it really was. While the whole spiral drive is "different," it's not that bad if you take it slow. I would absolutely stay here again and most definitely recommend this hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise.”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Platinum member I have generally avoided the Sheraton chain in the past because of some bad experiences, but decided to give the Sheraton Suites in San Diego a chance. I was very impressed. The rooms are modern and clean and I can't say enough about the comfort of the beds and pillows. Wow, what a great night sleep. This is an older building, but they do a great job maintaining it and keeping it clean and fresh. The hotel has a nice pool and fitness center, although it would have been better to see a set of free weights in the fitness center instead of a clunky old weight machine. I have stayed at the W hotel on a couple occasions, but I may actually prefer the Sheraton Suites over the W. I read that parking is a bit of a haste here so I just opted to park in one of the nearby lots for $5 per night and never had a problem. The front desk met all of my requests with a smile. Sorry W Hotel, I think I will be coming back to the Sheraton Suites next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “They had me at "hello"!”
Reviews.Author: Dmfluha
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, the hotel staff was at my service. The "upgrade" to the preferred guest floor was a nice surprise and appreciated. The room was so comfortable I stayed in more than I planned to! I'll return to enjoy it all over again, and hopefully SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sisters61
Reviews.Content: My sisters, neices, and I stayed at the Suites a couple of weekends ago. Have to say that Jason and Zac in the main lounge are top notch staff and truly made our time at the hotel fun. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel price was good - but hidden fees in internet and parking”
Reviews.Author: nkasparian
Reviews.Content: Positives: Hotel is good and in the middle of downtown. It is clean and accommodating. Negatives:Parking is horrible. Self-park is $23 and valet is $30. Don't try to self-park, because you might crash into the narrow walls and go up to the 12th floor to park. Also, the water seems to not drain when you shower or use the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but parking is ridiculous!”
Reviews.Author: BMCDinSD
Reviews.Content: The mini suites were nice and pretty clean. Ice machine was broken on our floor- called to see if someone could bring some up and was told "We don't have ice down here so you will have to go down or up a floor and get it yourself." I thought they really went out of their way for us! HA! It is nicely located in downtown, but the parking fee is crazy to me. I guess that goes with the territory of a downtown hotel. Overall is was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Rediscover this property...many changes for the better...wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: This property has undergone a quiet makeover....you will contonue to be greeted by Umit Corut whom remembers your name as do many pf the staff. Jason continues to tend the bar with his witty demeanor and Frank continues tp excel at the bar when Jason is not there. The rooms are quiet and all of them are suites so you do not have to be an elite member to have a nice room. The blue striped bedspreads have been replaced with the white bedding similar to the Westin Heavenly bed and i guess completes the sweet sleeper upgrade to the property. The flat panel TVs are mounted on the wall and the living area has more space. The water pressure in the separate shower was great. When i called for a wakeup call, i was surprised that Chris, the telephone operator, greeted me by name. The service is every bit as good as any four seasons hotel chain. Liberty continues to be the best server in the restaurant and the club lounge has improved and rumor among frequent visitors is tnat it will have an espresso machine soon in addition to a full time server or attendant. The lobby was bright and looked upscale from previous trips. This property has improved dramatically which is an indication that it is either under new ownership or management. Since i overheard someone mention Barry's name, it must be new owners. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location, Lousy Housekeeping!!”
Reviews.Author: janais2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for almost two weeks over the Christmas holiday season and just loved it for the location! It's just four blocks away from the trolley which takes you to a number of interesting, cultural and historic sites, and a few blocks away from various bus lines which can also get you to the major tourist attractions like Balboa Park, Ol' Town and others. The famous Gaslamp Quarter with tons of restaurants and entertainment spots is within walking distance - about 15 minutes, as is the Westfield Horton Mall which offers a wide variety of stores for shoppers. My travel companion and I had a suite and we found it quite comfortable as the separated living area gave us enough space to maneouvre and relax without getting into each other's way. We also had a nice view of the city and the mountains from our room. The hotel staff was always friendly, and the Concierge Staff was particularly friendly and helpful. Special kudos to Craig Holbrook, the head of the Concierge team who was super-friendly, very professional and just outstanding! My only complaint with this hotel was the housekeeping. This was a MAJOR problem and a MAJOR disappointment for us. The room did not seem to have been vacuumed before we checked in, and I am sure it was not vauumed once during our whole stay. Many days the room was obviously not properly cleaned - our dirty coffee cups, glasses and crumbs on the carpets etc. awaiting us when we returned. More often than not, we had to ask for or leave notes requesting that the supplies be replenished (shampoo, soap, lotion, coffee, etc.) even when it should have been fairly obvious. I am not accustomed to this poor level of houskeeping in any of the hotels I've stayed at in different parts of the world, and I certainly do not expect it in a Sherton hotel. I hope that the hotel will address this situation very quickly, as it detracts from what is otherwise, a perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with the exception of housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Jamaicanyardie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located outside of the Gaslamp Quarter and you have to walk a few blocks to get there but this was not a problem to us because we used it as exercise and there is a lot to see as you walk there. Shopping is nearby and it is close to buses and trollies that will get you to the must sees like Balboa Park and Old Town. The hotel itself is nice - the rooms are comfortable and well appointed. You could get internet in the lobby for free but by my next trip I hope that they have free internet in the rooms. Ate in the restaurant only twice and it was fine but as people have noted relatively expensive so we chose to eat outside most of the time. The heated pool and spa are nice and the gym is okay but a bit small - only a few treadmills and cycles, no weights. The staff were very nice and warm - they greet you with a "Welcome back" as you come through the lobby which is very nice and the concierge staff were always very informative and helpful. The big disappointment was housekeeping - we noticed from the very first night that the room was not as sparkling clean as you would have expected and it never got better. There were many times when we came in and had to do our own cleaning up after the housekeeper had cleaned. The housekeeper was also inconsistent - sometimes you got replenished supplies, sometimes you didn't. I expect better from any hotel and I really didn't expect this of a Sheraton at all. Hopefully this is something that they can fix because the hotel is very nice otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “That parking garage was a bit scary”
Reviews.Author: Evita49
Reviews.Content: We travelled w/our 2 kids so we appreciated the room layout, providing privacy for parents. Rooms need renovating, i.e., spots on the carpet, bathroom shower curtain rod was rusty! Tho designated nonsmoking room my brother/family had to move out of their room as it reaked of smoke! The biggest thing we didn't like was that you had to drive up a corkscrew like route to the 6th flr then up to the 11th flr before you can finally park your car! We will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms, but very nice customer service”
Reviews.Author: Luckey22
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty and not clean at all. We had to get all new bedding the first day after arriving. Customer service was good, but will not stay there again due to lack of cleanliness. DON'T eat at the hotel. The food is horrible. I like to eat, but would never eat there, yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Eager to please--a few things to note”
Reviews.Author: andrealb
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an enjoyable stay. We normally prefer the Starwood hotels, so this was a good choice for our family given that it is a suites hotel. The bell hop/valets were always helpful with directions, the check-in process was speedy and she was very eager to please. A few things to know: We stayed on the 25th floor and the rooms are in need of updating.Wallpaper, popcorn ceilings, a bit dated....but, maybe they are waiting for a better economy. Can't fault 'em! We had a view of the airport and all the planes coming in, we loved it because our 4 year old son enjoyed watching them land. However, if you want a quiet room without the roar of airplanes, you may want a different side of the hotel or possibly a hotel located in a different area. Room service: Holy smokers...$34 for an order of pancakes, an order of bacon and an ice tea. I stayed at the Sheraton in Moorea, Tahiti where a breakfast for two was less expensive! Exorbitant. Parking: Yes, exorbitant too. $20 for self park, $30 for valet (per day). We scored and found street parking across the street for two of our three days--but that was because of the holidays. Oh, and a drunk guy was knocking at our door in the middle of the night and we called hotel security--they were Johnny on the spot--so that was good. We weren't concerned...just a young kid having a good time and lost his room in the sea of rooms, but it was nice that they were quick to act. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good! Be aware of a few things...”
Reviews.Author: Pippi225
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel in a good location. Fiance and I stayed here for business so it was covered by his company (probably wouldn't stay here otherwise since we were here 8 days). Before you stay here, be aware that things that other, lower quality and lower rate hotels offer for FREE are costly here. For example...parking is NOT included and costs $23 a day (you have to head up to the 11th floor to park) which is added at the end of your stay. So factor that into your budget before looking for a hotel. Wireless internet is NOT included in your rooms. It's great in the lobby if you want to sit on a couch to get online. Kind of annoying but not a big deal. There is NO continental breakfast so be prepared to spend $14 on a buffet of the same caliber you'd find at a free Marriott continental breakfast. (Also, I would NOT recommend the hotel restaurant...we went there once, our server disappeared during our ENTIRE meal...no drink refills, and we had to track her down for our check, making us late.) Other than that, it was good. Location is nice, within walking distance to some great spots if you want to go out for drinks or a meal later. The room was lovely. Staff was friendly to my fiance (although I was annoyed when we checked in...the front desk attendant immediately said, "we'll be with you in a moment, sir," and "How are you today, sir?" completely annoying me and referring to my fiance for the duration of the check-in process even though the reservation was under my name and my credit card. A little sexist and off-putting, I thought). I loved the hot tub and fitness center area. If you can overlook the excess charges that are complimentary in most hotels and don't mind paying over $20 a night for parking, it would be a fairly good option.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Firelional
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, Our view was of a roof top and HVAC equipment. The only true problem was the comfort of the bedding and mattres. What a long night it was we changed rooms the second night but the mattress was not much better. The TV in bedroom of both rooms was as old as the hay sacks we slept on. Location was a bit far from the main walking areas of the gas lamp district but that was not a real issue. I would not stay in this Hotel again until they upgraded the sleeping gear. I'm a bigger body builder type at 225 and my wife is a lean fit 115 pounder and we both woke up like we spent the night on the gym floor. Staff was nice... Well thats all I have to say about that... Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievabler”
Reviews.Author: abbyelgin
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively over the past decade. I have never had to pay for internet access in a hotel in over 10 years (Marriott, Hilton, Holiday Inn, etc). This is my first Sheraton stay in quite some time. Maybe all Sheratons charge for this. I will never stay in a Sheraton again. An incredible a rip off. Restaurant was fine. Employees were nice. But nicke and dimeing guests is rediculous.

Reviews.Title: “Besides "Nickel and diming" its not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: doctanner80
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and we went there to celebrate my birthday. The room was beautiful. My recommendation, bring your own food or eat in the dining room. Do not order room service. The gratuity and delivery charge is what ruined it for me at its rate. On top of that we ordered breakfast and it was bad. The pancakes tasted like sponges and the bacon was overcooked. If you dont order room service, the hotel itself is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with nice views”
Reviews.Author: Fran888
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel! Alittle bit on the expensive side. Breakfast downstairs was about 18 dollars per person. If we are paying $200 a night can't you make breakfast free like most hotels do? Also the parking was NOT free and was not easy to get to. The parking for the hotel is on the 11th floor in the garage. When we checked in we where not told about a card that they need to give us to get in and out of the garage. Although this hotel had a few cons I would stay here again and would recommend it. I loved the feel and the cleanliness and the view from our room was priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: wrobinson47
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego for a conference this month, and stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Suites. The location is terrific - a few blocks from the GasLamp area, but not so close that it's right in the middle of the buzz of activity. It was also a 5-7 minute drive from the bay and the waterfront. The rooms were a terrific value - plenty of space, modern furniture, big bathrooms with separate showers and bathtubs, decent amenities (fitness room, pool, etc). And the views from the rooms are AWESOME! And the staff was attentive and helpful. I never tried the restaurants, so I can't speak to that (they looked fine) - and the parking was a little pricey ($23/day) but easy to navigate. And free wireless in the lobby. All in all, definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Add 20 minutes and 20$ for parking every day - and don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeans5
Reviews.Content: Positives: close to downtown, terrific noise control (considering you're next to the flight path), friendly service, clean rooms, comfortable suite, clean towels and sheets. Negatives: the cafe is filthy - espresso machine wand coated with days? weeks? of milk crud, morning pastry display case smeared with yucky stuff, sneeze guard superficially wiped, tongs crusy, chairs filthy, table not crumbed between service. The parking structure is not only $20.00 a day, but you must travel about 10 minutes to get to the 11th floor - coming up, and coming down. Small pool.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Janie5521
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on top of the Symphony Hall, with views of the city and water in the distance. Within walking distance to restaurants, shops, and transit. The restaurant in the hotel is quite good. Service was excellent. The concierges were very helpful. The only things I would change would be to ask the hotel to provide free wireless service from t e room (it is available in the lobby for free). Also, to request that they don't allow smoking in front of the street entrance, as the smoke travels into the lobby and elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Content: The mattress was so old and caved in.we would never stay at another sheraton.I am a gold starwood member and used 10k points ,I have already talked to starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome, Awesome”
Reviews.Author: terrdaly
Reviews.Content: Would definitely suggest this hotel to anyone. Staff was extremely helpful, the room was clean and plenty of space. Probably one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: errtra
Reviews.Content: Negative: Toll free calls from your room are charged $1.50. Lobby is 12th floor and you need 2 elevators to get to your room. There is a microwave but no refrigrator. It is about 5-6 blocks to get away from the homeless people surrounding the hotel. Up on a hill if you intend to walk to 'downtown' areas take note. Stall showers with separate tubs. Shower doors were moldy. No wireless internet in guest room - wired exists at approx 10/dy cost on which my VPN hookup failed several times. Has an honor bar with the usual rip-off prices. Seems to be a hotel with practices that are about 10 years out of date. Positive - quick check-in (never confirmed rate with me though). Room generally is clean. About 10 minutes drvie from airport (but all hotels in thsi area are). About 3 blocks trolley if you need to go to places near the trolley line. Would not recommend if choice exists - have stayed in other hotels in vicinity that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: cosmicaura
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving at the hotel, I was a little concerned after reading quite a few less than stellar reviews here on TripAdvisor. However, I have to say most of my concerns were unfounded. A few reviewers have expressed bewilderment over the lobby being on the twelfth floor, but it should be clear to anyone who has stayed at the hotel that the reason for this is because the bottom floors are taken up by Symphony Hall - hence the hotel name! I thought that was kind of cool myself. :) Walking from the L-12 elevator to the 12-26 elevator was not an inconvenience since they are located so close to one another. We opted for valet parking, so didn't have to deal with the "corkscrew" and parking hassles. The entire staff was excellent - from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Lots of hefty tips were left and very well-deserved. The suites are much larger than standard sized rooms and I noted our room was very clean and maintained in the same manner throughout our stay. Yes, there are a few minor signs, such as the chipped caulking around the shower, pointing to the fact the hotel is a little older, but nothing that detracted from a pleasant stay. Beds were comfortable, pillows were fluffy, views were excellent out of all the windows, and the decor was updated. Would recommend to anyone looking for a centrally located hotel with great rates and service!

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mstktravlr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is In a beautiful location but the hotel experience was a total hassle. Driving through the parking structure to the 11th floor seems more fitting as an obstacle course and and having to pay 23 dollars per day for the privilege is actually insulting. Having to take 2 elevators to get to your room seems excessive. The room size and configuration and view was great, however the furniture and the carpet were stained, the coffee table scratched, and it did not contain the amenities as described. In order to get free internet you had to go to the lobby, or pay a daily fee, which is archaic in this day and age and was extremely inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are hard”
Reviews.Author: Misstravelqueen7
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and very close to the Zoo. Front desk staff were nice to us. Parking is very expensive, 23 night or 30 for valet. We did valet the first day because we were tired from driving. The bed is harder than Fred Flinstone's bed!!! Geeesh, we woke up with stiff backs. Overall, good hotel..we paid $99 a night (gov rate) it was worth it. Oh you can walk around because there's lots of restaurants close by...easy to navigate too.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the service”
Reviews.Author: coloanna
Reviews.Content: Parking was terrible. The room wasn't cleaned until we asked for it to be cleaned. The floor was never swept. We were very surprized that there was not wireless available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: travelj106
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited San Diego for the Labor Day Weekend. After booking the hotel on Priceline I visited trip advisor because I had not previously stayed at the Sheraton Suites. While most of the reviews were positive there were a few things that concerned me. There were several mentions about the hotel's cleanliness not being up to standard. When I arrived I checked out the public areas and my room more carefully than normal and the hotel easily ranked 5 stars. Even the floor behind the TV stand and under the bed were spotless. Nice French doors separated the sleeping and living areas and the bath was large with separate bathtub and shower. The staff that I encountered were polite and very helpful. On Labor Day morning I needed towels. They were delivered promptly and the front desk even called to make sure they had arrived. The comforter did slip off the bed easily because of its fabrication. A previous poster had noted this. Another poster thought there was too much furniture in the living room. I agree, I would eliminate the chair and go just with the sleep sofa. The hill that the hotel is located on is steep but walkable unless you have restrictions. The hotel is an easy walk to the Trolley, Gaslamp district, 2 drugstores (CVS and Riteaid), 7Eleven, Starbucks, etc. I did not take advantage of the restaurant, exercise area, pool, etc. The biggest concern that I had after reading many of the postings was the garage. I can tell you that it is quite unique. If you take it slow and easy and pay attention it is not a big deal. You go up a tight concrete spiral for the first 7 or 8 floors seeing nothing but the concrete walls on each side. Then you go through five or so floors of parking ( most with a different traffic flow) to get to the hotel's parking on the 11th floor. Then you take an elevator to the hotel lobby on the 12th floor. I had a very comfortable stay and enjoyed the room more than the one at the Grand Hyatt, where I stay several months ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the Heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mlbmickey
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about booking here because of some of the reviews, but I am SO glad I did. We went to a concert at Symphony Hall and it was SO amazing to park the car, walk to dinner, and never leave the building to go back to our room. It was clean, quiet, and great service. Like many hotels, they charged $23 a night to park the car, room service tacked on several charges including a 20% gratuity. Restaurant was great for breakfast, but be sure and ask for an Omlette if the made to order isn't offered. Our waiter didn't tell us, and we already had food before we heard another waitress offering omlettes. Join their Starwood Preferred Guest program and you get to stay on the 25th or 26th Floor. BIG rooms, nice living rooms, tub PLUS shower. Good times!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY UNCOMFORTABLE BED”
Reviews.Author: plateshopper
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights with a group for a wedding. The hotel lobby is very nice. The bar is a little outdated, but still nice. The breakfast buffet was nice (especially enjoyed the made to order omelet). We had a room on the 27th floor with a wonderful view. The size of the room/suite is a definite plus. All the staff we encountered were nothing but nice to us. They have a great team working there. Now the downside....THE BED WAS VERY UNCOMFORTABLE!!!! I have stayed in many Sheratons and was thrilled a Sheraton was chosen for the out of town guests because they always have great beds...or so I thought. Sheraton touts the "SWEET SLEEPER" bed. It was so bad, I called the front desk to inquire about getting a room with the sweet sleeper. They informed me all of their rooms have them. I said this bed is nothing like any other Sheraton I have been in. I WAS TOLD THESE MATTRESSES ARE THE "OLD STYLE SWEET SLEEPER"! Well, there is nothing "sweet" about them, they are however quite "OLD". Everyone in our group agreed the beds were sadly lacking in comfort. I did strip the bed covers to look at the label on the mattress (which was very old) and could find nothing referring to "sweet sleeper". We did opt to stay the second night because everyone from our group was there. We bummed a couple of vicodin and then were able to sleep thru the night. Now for the car parking. The cost is $24. per day. You have to go up a very tight spiral drive to the 12th floor. The parking spaces are VERY TIGHT. You can park just across the street from the hotel for $10. per day. It is in the brick building across the street. The entrance is on 8th St. (it is an indoor parking lot). Also, just across from the entrance is another parking lot which is outdoors, I believe that one was $8. per day. I really strongly urge you to use the parking across the street as it is much more convenient. It is much easier than navigating the Hotels parking. (actually takes less time to cross the street to the private parking lot than to come down the very steep spiral drive at the hotel). All this being said, If you can put up with the UNcomfy bed, everything else is pretty darn good.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectation.”
Reviews.Author: jebigbear
Reviews.Content: I just had a stay at the hotel with 18 female friends for just one night so we could attend a Michael Buble concert. We had at least 7 rooms. The staff was so accommodating & friendly. I wish I had taken down names but it was everyone I was in contact with from check in to check out. I loved in the evening how they served champagne in the lobby. The rooms were spotless clean. It is so close to the Gaslamp area of good shops & restaurants. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again with my husband as soon as I can. Good job everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rudenessbfuntimes
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton Suites San Diego and had a very pleasant and memorable experience. The location was great, the rooms were very clean and spacious and the service was great! I am planning on coming back next summer and I will definately be returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton on top of the hill”
Reviews.Author: CelsoSO
Reviews.Content: Nice breakfast menu and buffet. The crew were very helpfull and polite. The location is on top of a hill, could see the bay, some 13 blocks from the convention center, through Gaslamp area, full of restaurant and bars.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfied, did not get what we expected”
Reviews.Author: CALIFORNIATRAVELERS5
Reviews.Content: We had a late arrival to the hotel and we called them to advise we would be running l,ate at 9pm. Upon arrival we were told our room was given to someone else and we were placed in a corner room much smaller than what we actually booked. When i complained to front desk they said there was nothing they could do to accomodate us. Staff was not as polite as I expected since this is a Sheraton Hotel. The parking was a night mare. We had to go up a spiral drive way which went up several floors. Parking was $24 per day and they were not notied of this until we arrived at the hotel. Needless to say, this will be the last time we stay at a Sheratan location

Reviews.Title: “Love the bed”
Reviews.Author: Gayle1963
Reviews.Content: Your staff has been helpful and accomodating every time I've stayed with you from checking in early to bringing me a robe prior to turning in. The beds are so comfortable and this is what I look forward to!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: michelleg516
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Self parking was not that bad as others had describe it. Frontdesk was very helpful with directions and always smiled as went by. The only issue we had was the remote for the TV in the bedroom did not work and the pull out bed was broken. Our granddaughter fell thru but she was okay. The springs were missing so we just pulled the mattress out and placed it on the floor for the kids to sleep on. I did inform the frontdesk and they said they would have someone fix it. other then that we enjoyed are stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and service would highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcadengo
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect choice if you want to be close to downtown San Diego for the Gaslamp district and Balboa park and many of the other "must do" attractions. It was a 20 minute drive to Carlsbad for Legoland which we did two days in a row. We had a great experience overall!

Reviews.Title: “Discourtesy staff, average room.”
Reviews.Author: smibison
Reviews.Content: For the Starwood points we paid for this suite, I expected much more. The room was average and half of the night was spent retrieving the slippery bedspread from the floor. The staff ranged from dismissive and rude to merely useless. I am bewildered by the fact we couldn't get hotel shuttle service to or from the airport I could see from my suite window.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: jcsuperstar333
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was less then expected for the price of the room. It was reported that when the bathtub was drained the water backed up into the bathroom sink. No action was taken to correct the problem - we were there 5 days. The room itself, for a suite is badly set up. One tiny counter with sink in the bathroom for a room that can easily sleep four - there were three of us and we had to take turns to look into the mirror. No extra blankets or pillows were available in the room for the pull out bed, something I have always found in my other hotel stays. We only ate breakfast at the hotel one time, which was more than enough. The food was average and the service lacking. For our last day a late check out was not available. We stay in San Diego at least once a year, but never at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “$30 a day parking fee, room not ready, stained carpet, Beautiful view.”
Reviews.Author: MelaniHarley
Reviews.Content: For as much as this room costs I was blown away buy the stained carpet, mold in the shower, a phone didn't work, and after paying for an upgrade (that was refunded) we didn't have the "upgrade items" until the day of departure. We had the "Be Green" sign on our door (means not to clean towels or sheets so it's better for environment) but the cleaning staff took that to be a "do not disturb" sign and didn't bring our requested items. That might have happened since the two ladies I dealt with barely spoke english. The elevator didn't work. AND WE WERE CHARGED $30 A DAY TO PARK OUR CAR THERE! YES, EVEN THOUGH WE WERE PAYING CUSTOMERS WHO WERE STAYING AT THE HOTEL WE HAD TO PAY $60 ONTOP OF OUR BILL!!!!!! Even though the view was beautiful and the lobby was gorgeous I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: we_wander
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a romantic getaway mid-week. We live in North County but had never done the San Diego Tourist thing so we booked a room at the Sheraton Symphony and found it very pleasant. My husband had a broken foot at the time and the hotel loaned us a wheelchair to go sight-seeing with. We were up-graded to a one-bedroom suite and provided goodies in our room nightly. We are SPG members so that might explain some of it. However, by the time we came back in the evening, my husband just wanted to ice his foot so the club level concierge would make me up a tray of snacks to bring back to our room. Yes, the hotel is old and is probably gonna need new carpets soon, but alot of Sheratons are in older properties that have character! That's what makes its a nice experience- its not cookie-cutter opulence. We found the hotel very clean and the staff VERY helpful and accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, to the hotels down by the marina.”
Reviews.Author: hbsurf_10
Reviews.Content: I was appalled when I climbed into bed at 12:45 AM only to discover that the sheets and mattress were wet (about a one-foot sq section). Fortunately, the staff was prompt in getting me moved to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty suites”
Reviews.Author: fluidtlm
Reviews.Content: Since I was travelling with a toddler I wanted an accomodation with a kitchenette and I chose the Sheraton suites. My entire stay was a nightmare and I will never stay here again. I am a starwood club member and when I stay at their family of hotels I always get to stay in their preferred floors with extra amenities. When we were checking in I was told that I will not be staying in the preferred floor which was fine as we were tired from a long flight and just wanted a clean space for my toddler to roam around in. Upon entering the room I immediately noticed that the mini-fridge wasn't working, it actually had a note apologizing for the inconvenience. I called the front desk and they immediately sent an engineer with another fridge. They clearly knew that the fridge wasn't working yet they were willing to put us in that suite as they even had the crib put in before we even arrived which made me question their serivice to their customers. We went to bed without even unpacking and when we woke up the next day, we were disgusted by what we saw. My toddler was running around holding a pack of cigarrettes (we're non smokers). We found several packs of cigarettes in bed side cabinets on both sides of the beds from previous guests. We later discovered beer bottle caps lodged on to the ceiling in the living room. We called the front desk and they apologized once again and promised they'll send someone up to clean those stuff. When we got back to the hotel later that evening, we were surprised to find the cigarretes still in one of hte cabinets. My toddler also found more cigarettes under the bed and I was more disgusted by the level of cleanliness in the hotel. I once again called the front desk, they never once offered to change our room but offered to send the cleaning lady. After waiting for several hours we asked them not to bother sending someone up as my toddler was asleep. The next day while my toddler was napping, they were knocking on the door and called our suite to see whether they can come into inspect the room(after 24 hours of placing the initial call). We usually have a very good experience in Sheraton hotels but we were disgusted at this location by their management and the cleaning staff. Breakfast in the hotel is $20/person for hot breakfast buffet, however, the little cafe on the 6th and B street is fantastic and reasonably priced with friendlier staff. As for the location, it is walking distance to the Gaslamp district and 10 min drive to the zoo. There is a valet parking but we chose self parking and it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: leannl
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed for 5 nights at this and will be back next time we are in San Diego. The staff was pleasant and helpful and the room met our expectations in every way. thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ARS819
Reviews.Content: We stayed here very last minute. We live in No. San Diego, and had a litte too much fun downtown, and decided to find a hotel. It was walking distance, and a really great price for government employees. We even found a late night delivery pizza place that delievered yummy pizza. We had a large suite with separate bedroom from the living room, stock frige, couch w/ pull out bed, and nice robes.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in every way”
Reviews.Author: ToddFrench
Reviews.Content: For the price, given this is in the middle of downtown, and therefore quite convenient, I expected much less from this room and hotel. The room we were given had a fantastic view, was very clean, and incredibly spacious. The bathroom was so spacious I think it is a waste of space, but no complaints. The staff was as friendly as what you would find at a fine resort, from the desk staff to the hospitality staff to the valets. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomendations but not so good parking.”
Reviews.Author: LisaR019
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for price however hated parking. Parking is a bit pricey $23 and have to park on 11th floor up a very curvy road and then around NARROW structure to get to hotel parking. Not SUV friendly or pleasant when having to come and go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Charm20
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean and centrally located to everything, was able to walk everywhere. Park across the street from the Hotel for $10.00 a day instead of the Hotel's $23.00 a day and you will be completely satisfied. Kind of Small for a Suite, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great people make remarkable experiences”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: I do not know where to begin. I typically earn platinum status each year and half of my stays are at this property. It used to be a Marriott many years ago and is an aging property however, it was recently renovated. All of the rooms are the same size so if you travel with non spg member guests, everyone gets the same experience. The people make this hotel work and they are the most hospitable and friendliest staff to meet. I highly recommend you look for Umit, Corneisha, or Linette when checking in. They are the finest star wood front desk persons I have ever met and this is after visiting 213 Starwood properties. The hotel has a club lounge however the guy whom manages it continues to disappoint me in how poorly it is ran. I stayed at the property twice this week and both times it was empty and water was scarce. I know California has water shortages and you will rediscover it applies to their club lounge. In the past six visits to the property, the club lounge was an embarrasment to the hotel name and chain. In all my visits, i have come to know all of the staff except for the guy whom manages the club partly since he is not that friendly. This is not the norm. I recommend you sit at the Skyy Bar during happy hour or in the evening and look for Zach or Jason. Both are very personable and will give you pointers on where to go. If you suffer from allergies, the hotel has Pure rooms that are allergen free and are available. I think you need to request it either when booking a room or when checking into the hotel. I tried it twice and it is good. If you eat at the restaurant you may find the buffet to be boring. I recommend the French toast cinnamon rolls named after Manny in the kitchen or the Renditions scramble. The Renditions scramble is awesome. It is scrambled egg whites with veggies and feta cheese. The chef is John and do not be afraid to aak for him. Unlike then guy whom manages the restaurant, he wants to talk to you and is passionate about food and his creations. He used to do eggs Benedict with crab meat in lieu of Canadian bacon. Five stars to Renditions and a negative five stars for it's manager. When eating there, ask for liberty as your server. She is awesome and I always enjoy it when she serves me. Yes, the plumbing is old. I have had rooms where sink water pressure was less Ghana desirable and believe the hotel is fixing this since I have not experienced it recently. The beds have been upgraded to the sweet sleeper and standard with the brand but the tv in the rooms are still older tube TVs and need to migrate to flat screens. Self parking is 23 dollars a day. I recommend valet for 30. In summary, save your money if upgrading to the club floor. The lounge is small and poorly ran and is more of an embarrassment. I am finding myself staying here less and less. My next three trips to San diego are at other properties that offer more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spacious suite, great food, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: maxtraveling
Reviews.Content: I asked for and was given a high floor room. The suite was immaculate with luxury Westin style toiletries, separate bath and shower, microwave, 2 TVs (1 was flat screen), marvelous view and comfortable furniture with a nice desk and lots of outlets for laptop or cell phones. It looked recently renovated. The absolute best part was the bed! It was so comfortable, I wished I could have skipped my business meetings and stayed in bed all day. I didn't t use the indoor pool but saw families having fun there. I did use the fitness room- small but with very modern equipment, TV and radio. It was not crowded and I had a nice workout. The food here is very, very good. Their salmon dishes are excellent and they have a nice variety of dishes. The staff went out of their way to be pleasant. There are 5 computers in the lobby you can use free with Internet access. The one thing I did not like was that you have to pay for Internet access in your room- although it didn't affect me as I used my iPad to connect to the Internet over the AT&T network. Overall I will definitely come back and bring my family for a San Diego vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay for a Starwood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasonfair
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Sheraton Suites, San Diego and experienced a less than desirable stay. We arrived after 3 pm and our room was not ready. We were assigned a different room that was not on the Starwood Preferred Floor. Upon our arrival to the room we notice that there was not a separate shower and bathtub, which we preferred because we were traveling with a baby. From a previous stay at this hotel we were aware that the king bedrooms did have a separate bathtub. We called down to the front desk to inquire about the possibility of getting a room with two double beds that has a separate shower. The front desk person did not know if the other two rooms, soon to be ready, had a separate bathtub or if these types of rooms have a separate bathtub all together. We then had to go downstairs, get two different keys to go investigate the rooms ourselves. To our disappointment the rooms did not have a separate bathtub, which we then assumed did not exist for a room with two double beds. It would have been nice if the staff knew the layouts of the rooms so that we did not have to be inconvenienced. So, we were content to stay in our current room until I realized how dirty it was. The room was poorly dusted and our toddler picked up candy off the floor and almost ate it. Needless to say the floor was not vacuumed properly. We then called down to the front desk and informed them of the situation and we were then moved to another room. We requested a bellman, but none was available at the time. There appeared to be only one bellman?? We moved our luggage to the new room. Once again my toddler found candy and chips on the floor. I had to thoroughly inspect the entire room for debris left on the floor. There were chips and candy behind the curtains and under the beds. It appears that your cleaning staff does not feel the need to vacuum behind the curtains. Upon my search for miscellaneous debris on the ground we noticed that the box spring of one of the beds was not properly positioned on the frame. We had to fix this ourselves to make sure the bed was properly secured. There were also stains on the comforters of the beds. We then proceeded to unpack and utilize the dresser drawers in the bedroom. One drawer was clearly not on the track and I had to fix it to be able to use it. By the way the drawers are very difficult to open and close. The bathroom was also less than sufficient. There appeared to be mold/mildew in the corner of the bathtub and hair in the bottom of the tub. The toilet seat was not securely fastened to the toilet and shifted when used. The entire toilet also shifted and banged against the wall when getting on and off. The garbage can under the vanity was also missing. Also, just to inform you when the neighboring room started their shower, our shower went cold, but then returned to warm water. The next day we attempted to watch TV and realized that one of the remote controls was missing. We had to request 3-4 times to get it replaced. After our room had been serviced one day we were not given new glasses or our complimentary waters. Also, while we walked to our room one day we noticed the cleaning staff using the floor vacuum to vacuum the couch. This seems to be a practice that is not very sanitary. This makes me believe that your couches are just as dirty as the floors. On the contrary to all of these issues, the valet service was excellent. The gentlemen that helped us were courteous and helpful. We never had to wait for our vehicle when we called down to let them know we were coming. We almost always stay at Starwood Hotels and this has to be by far the most disappointing stay that we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: travellinbetty
Reviews.Content: These are supposed to be renovated rooms. I didn't see much evidence of that. The carpet was dirty, the wall paper was peeling at the edges and slightly discolored, the bed spread was old looking. I wasn't impressed at all and wouldn't recommend it. It was ok. The one good thing about it is that you can walk to the Gaslamp District if you wanted. I wouldn't do it in heels, its quite a walk, but in tennis shoes its fine. Cab fare to central Gaslamp is less than $5.

Reviews.Title: “a good suite hotel, spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: moseo
Reviews.Content: well managed with good staff all round. However a few suggestions: 1. vacuuming of hall way too early and very noisy 2. the sofa bed is incredibly bad- please feel the wires sticking out and nobody could sleep on it without hurting his back! please check. 3. room cleaning forgetting to refill with drinking water, soap and tissue

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: halfwalker
Reviews.Content: we came to SD for the RNR marathon and half... and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. it was so close to everything, the location worked out perfectly for us -- walking distance to the zoo, gaslamp quarter, convention center, horton plaza shopping center, and TONS of great restaurants. relaxing in the spa after the race was a huge bonus. it was great having some extra space in the room for our stay, and we had no complaints about anything. we especially liked the "go green" option to forgo room cleaning service for a $5 credit one day -- keep that option open! i would definitely stay here again next time i'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “You Don't Always Get What You Ask For”
Reviews.Author: sammy1runner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton during the San Diego Rock N Roll Marathon. Booked on line. Though I booked a two room suite with king bed in each, however, I was given yes, two rooms. However, there were two double beds in one, and a hideabed in the livingroom. French Doors seperated the rooms...Misleading, but I got what I asked for! Be more specific when booking your rooms..Specify 2 Bdrm, not just 2 rms. Joke on me I guess! Very awkward having to share 1 bedroom with two adult couples that were not family! Then there is the parking situation. If you use their parkade, you have to drive all the way up to the 11th floor, then you take an elevator to get to the check in to then take another elevator to get to your room. I was getting dizzy just driving up the parkade, too many levels to get to the hotel. When I went to the front desk and mentioned that I did not get what I asked for and that the only reason I stayed there was that I thought that I was getting a 2 bedroom suite, they appologized and said "I can see how that would confuse you", but all of our room are like that..Please change your internet picture. Also the pool looked alot bigger in the pictures, very small. Also parking cost 23.00 US per day! Th

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes everything falls apart or rubber band soup”
Reviews.Author: caperelli
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is a downtown hotel, I could walk to Horton Plaza. BUT, our entire stay seemed to follow a down slope. Physically the room was very nice. Two t.v.s a separate sitting room, a work space and french doors to the bedroom. Microwave, coffee and special toiletries add a nice touch, However, every time the bathtub drained , it came up in the sink along with the "sewer smell" The water never got really hot and ran out quickly. {don't you hate that?} Unfortunately the re-decorated suites do not match the eating and bar areas. This is actually a large and beautiful space but it must be left from the 80"s.There is a center bar area surrounded by a brass rail, dark greens and blues the feeling is overwhelmingly old era Golden Nugget , To complicate matters the wait staff is never around. They seem to spend a lot of time in the back room. The chair I sat on for breakfast had an accumulation of sticky crumbs and grime between the edges of the cushion. The tortilla soup which we had for lunch was delicious, but had a rubber band in it. I would say the staff here pick up on this bizarre ambiance as they seemed pretty unhappy or unhelpful. BUSINESS TRAVELERS. We had a seminar here. We do this all the time.Our experience here may have been the worst. The physical room has low ceilings and bare bones. The set-up crew balked because we wanted some adjustments,They forgot part of the coffee service order and the event manager wasn't there. A few individuals tried to help, but if it isn't a total dedicated staff it doesn't work. Overall it was a very unpleasant stay and we will not use the seminar facilities or stay here again. .

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst”
Reviews.Author: Alex230
Reviews.Content: Let me start with positives. The property itself is solid. It feels like a typical Sheraton. Rooms are reasonably sized and mostly clean. Now, the negatives. Service is horrible. Starwood properties never seem to pride themselves on their service, but this location has got to be one of the worst. While staying there I decided to stop by their lounge/bar area to get a quick bite. The place was deserted besides me and a couple of other patrons. The bartender was glued to the TV. Once I managed to attract his attention, I ordered some chicken wings. Long story short, half an hour later I was still waiting for my order. The bartender mumbled something the wings being frozen, but reluctantly agreed to go to the kitchen and check on the order. Finally, after 40 minutes of waiting the food arrived. Along with the food a manager showed up and tried to convince me that it normally takes this long to heat up chicken wings. Among the arguments he sited were the facts that their chicken wings are special and that they are trying to protect their guests from salmonella. When I told him that it made no sense, he got offended and told me that I am making a big deal out of nothing. To add insult to an injury, the bartender tried to overcharge me and we had to argue about the bill for a while. Hardly the experience I wanted. Somebody somewhere must have told these guys that the customers are the root of all evil and should be treated accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Sheratons in San Diego !”
Reviews.Author: travelguy028
Reviews.Content: We visit San Diego on a regular basis with the direct flights from Denver it is a quick get away for us for a trip and we love the weather, and all the activities there are to do. we used our Starwood points this trip and stayed at 2 different properties. We stayed here at the Sheraton Suites the first 2 nights and another Sheraton the last 3 nights. Totally loved this hotel, really a terrific location so close to everything, Gaslight District, restaurants and the bay downtown. Best part is your room is a suite!! makes it very comfortable. Staff is very friendly and helpful in giving you tips of sights and activities close by. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: bcislandgirl
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Gold member, I was upgraded to the Club level, which provided Happy Hour lounge access in the early evening, and a few other amenities, such as a bathrobe, the WSJ in addition to USA Today at my door every morning and a single bottled water daily. That was nice. The room/suite was a decent size - it had a separate living room with a desk, microwave and small fridge. BUT, the bed was definitely not a Sheraton Sweet Sleeper (unfortunately), and the fridge required access with a key (asked at the desk). The only sink - in the bathroom - need a plumber - and the walls were pretty thin. The daily housekeeping was a little sloppy; had to ask for some of the amenities to be delivered because they were forgotten by the housekeeping staff. The restaurant is definitely a disappointment - ordered a Greek Salad that was mediocre at best, with I suspect, preheated phony chicken. Service was friendly and tried to be accommodating, but not at the caliber for this type of environment. Overall, I highly recommend skipping the restaurant. (You can get a far superior salad at the hole-in-the wall City Pizza a block away). Overall, the staff were friendly and helpful - no complaints there. The price was reasonable. It is easy to get around to other locations, as long as you are a walker, but if you have mobility challenges, and want easy access to the Convention Centre, Petco Park or the Gaslamp District, you should consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: suzzy230
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend away with my husband, and I was not impressed. I am a Starwood member and they said they put us on the SPG preferred floor, but right next to the elevator! We heard everything all night! The hill was a little tiresome because I have a bad back from a car accident. The parking was horrible so we just went to the valet and it was very expensive. The hotel was a little confusing with the lobby not being on the first floor, and the different elevator's you have to take to your room. Our "suite" was not that. It was just a normal sized room with a wall right at the foot of the bed to make a separate living room. Really not impressed! Would rather pay the same price and stay closer to Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Janet McPherson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights pre-cruise and were suitably impressed with the whole place. It starts on the 12th floor with parking floors below and we were on the 22nd floor and were surprised at how little noise there was, even with the windows open. The rooms are all suites with a separate lounge area and very well equipped with coffeemaking, microwave, iron and board, 2 TVs and ample storage space. The beds are extremely comfortable with good mattresses and ample pillows (we usually have to ask for extra). Watch out for the expensive in-room snacks! If you want M&Ms or bottled water go to the 7/11 store just down the street! The breakfast buffet is sumptuous and plentiful in beautiful light, airy surroundings, with an excellent array of hot and cold including smoked salmon, ham, fresh fruit (strawberries for breakfast - wow!), the BEST french toast with maple syrup by the gallon, bacon, eggs, potatoes, cereals and dried fruits, yoghurts, breads and every kind of juice. The staff are all excellent, friendly and attentive and a request for a tray of coffee for visiting family was met from the breakfast bar with a smile and no charge. All in all we could not fault it and it is within easy walking distance of the shops and restaurants in the old Gaslamp Quarter, where the mexican food at Los Panchos will not disappoint! For a bit of culture you are right next door to Symphony Hall and if you want THE best Barbecue in town visit Phil's Barbecue on Sports Arena Boulevard. They have THE best onion rings ever and a good dinner will only set you back between $6.50 and $12. Be prepared to queue outside but it is well worth the wait!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: peonygirl_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our 11th year anniversary. We thought we had gotten a good rate through priceline but that changed when we arrived. First, this is an old building that sits on a slanted hill (hello, earthquakes), the drive to the parking lot which is on the 11th floor is narrow and extremely claustophobic. By the time we reached the 11th floor we were already regretting it. The lobby is in the 12th floor then you take a different elevator to your room. We walked into our room which though roomy smelled musty (thank god i took scented candles), the carpet looked dirty and was stained. The bed was okay although I seemed to scratch all night after my husband's comments about bed bugs. Hair dryer was nasty and sticky, obviously they have overlooked that ammenity several times the room was freezing and though we adjusted the temperature to warm it never warmed up. My husband noticed the bottom of shower doors rusted and moldy. Needless to say, the following day we didn't wait until our check out time (12pm) we got out asap. I don't think this hotel should be considered a 31/2 star. It is more like a 2. Oh yeah, can't forget to mention the ridiculous parking fee of $22.00 per night for self parking or $28.00 for valet. In my opinion, I will gladly pay an extra $50.00 bucks and stay at a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1/2 and 1/2”
Reviews.Author: discerndee
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Another reviewer mentioned the steep hill while walking the area. Could be hard for some. We liked that we could walk to the Gaslamp area and the views were nice from our 25 floor. We were on the north side(?) so saw alot of planes coming in. Cool. The staff is mostly borderline rude and not knowledgeable about their own services. Phone staff told us there was no complimentary coffee until 8:00 but when we got down to the lobby at 7:00AM, there it was. And another time wouldn't cash a check, though their hotel book says they would and then didn't even guide us to the generic ATM they had in a hall. Found it on our own. But we figured it out. Breakfast was too pricey for us this time AT 19.00 buffet and 12.00 regular, but looked like a nice enough place to eat. Agree that the valet parking is the way to go, even if it seems high. (28.00) One less stressor and they were quick to bring the car up. The rooms need to be updated but we had plenty of space; we like the suites. Furniture worn, but clean. Free internet in lobby, about 6 terminals, with printer hooked up. Helped us alot with our plans for the day as we didn't have the laptop with us. (internet hookup is available in room for a charge) Even with the large choir that was staying in the hotel we seemed to be on a quite floor. Saw a couple of well behaved dogs in the hotel, so I guess its pet friendly. Mini bar key was not given to us at check in and they sent it up when we told them we wanted to put a few juices in there. Well stocked, but we don't use the merchandize. We got a good on line deal which made it worth it. 129.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: marylou073
Reviews.Content: Clean, convenient location, pretty room, and pleasant staff. Loved it - would gladly stay again. Only drawback - expensive food in the restaurant and pool was broken when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel loses points on location.”
Reviews.Author: tchefuncta
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on this hotel via Priceline. Since we didn't have a car, we didn't experience any of the parking trauma others have reported. The small suite rooms were very nice in size and decor, and were clean as well. Our bathroom had started to show its age as the shower door didn't quite fit right, grouting had been repaired but not well, etc. Overall the room was quite satisfactory, and an outstanding value. The front desk easily accomodated our request for a high-floor room with a view. A problem with a TV remote was fixed only after a trip to the lobby, but quickly thereafter. The only real negative to this property is its location. It is four blocks and up a steep hill from the nearest trolly stop, a good six blocks from the nearest point of the Gaslamp district, and much too far to consider from the convention center. If you are not a walker and need or want to be near the center of downtown San Diego, this hotel won't fit you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Business Hotel, Great for Family Group too!”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: This is a formerly Marriott Chain Hotel so the room size was built to the Marriott standard. Every room at this property is a suite. This is a very good property for convention groups or family visiting San Diego providing excellent values. Location: Close to the freeway, few minutes drive to all major attractions in San Diego. Lobby: Small but efficient. Located on the 12th floor. Staffs were friendly and answered my questions promptly. Was given breakfast vouchers and drink vouchers since I was staying at the Club Level. Gym: Located on the same floor as lobby. It was bit on the small side but got all the necessary equipments. Nice Jacuzzi and indoor pool too offering great views of San Diego skyline! Parking: Valet or Self available. The parking is quite a challenge there. I highly recommend parking lots located nearby hotels (for fraction of the price). Room: All Suite Configuration. All room sizes are identical. One living room plus a bedroom. Have French Door to separate the rooms. Living room area have full size sofa with pull up bed, TV, work station with free internet (club floor) and mini bar inside the room. Bedroom offers standard Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed, Standard Sheraton Bath Amenities. Separate TV in the bedroom area too. Very clean and I had a good night sleep there. Corner room offers slight more room and ask for the room facing SOUTH so you have better view of San Diego Skyline, very pretty! Overall: Excellent Value, Friendly Staff, Great for Family & Groups. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: chet_Maryland
Reviews.Content: I routinely stay here when i travel to the San Diego area. The hotel is comfortable and generally clean. the suites have a lot of room to spread out. Bathrooms are large and water pressure is good. Beds are comfortable. Parking is expensive and breakfast buffet is overpriced, but all in all a comfortable hotel. Easy walk to restaurants in the Gas Light District

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Super Staff.”
Reviews.Author: gnomeguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in downtown Dan DIego. Its about a five minute walk to the Gas Lamp District . By car, its a few minute drive to the Seaport, aboutt ten minutes to the world famous Zoo, and maybe fifteen minutes to Old Town San Diego. The hotel staff is super and seem to be genuinely interested in providing top quality service. The rooms are large and clean. In typical suite hotel style there is a living area with TV, and sofa, as well as a large bedroom with a second TV. A separate shower and tub are standard in each room. Parking is not for the faint of heart, as it's an upward spiral for six floors, then a loop around the garage for five more floors. Valet parking is not a bad choice, as it only adds an additional $6 to the parking garage charge of $22. While this may seem to be a little bit stiff, in fact it's about average for inner city , safe parking. Overall, I rate this place as a great establishment, and highly recommend it to future San Diego visitors.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerUpland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on January 30, 2010 and had a wonderful time. The service was very nice and our room was very quiet and comfortable. We had a lovely view of the city lights in the evening and the hotel is located a couple of blocks from the GasLamp Restaurant/Shops area. There is no need for a car---everything is within walking distance. This is a 4-Star Rated hotel and a very nice place to stay. The only concern is parking. You must enter the building into a very narrow circular driveway which winds around and around up to the 11th floor. On the 11th floor its very tight quarters. Be very careful to not hit other parked vehicles when to attempt to park your car. Yuck! Parking is $22/nite and Valet $28. However the hotel is lovely and a wonderful place to enjoy your stay. We would return on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great central San Diego Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bntzmimi
Reviews.Content: We got a great $60 a night price for this hotel. It's an all suite otel which was nice to have a bit more space= a small living room/ office space with a separate bedroom. It's nice central location. Not ideally close for anything downtown but walking distance to the the gaslamp district. Hotel parking is expensive, but street parking can easily be found around the hotel. On Saturdays after 6pm and Sundays it's free. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend hotel for leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: TDHArizona
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting San Diego for 20 years and this was my first visit to this hotel. There are far too many choices that are significantly better than this hotel. I got a good rate on the internet but parking was over $20 per day. Breakfast buffet which is not outstanding was $20 per person. The internet site said they had a shuttle which they did not offer. The restaurant closes early and late room service not available. The lobby is on the 12th floor, you park on the 11th floor so must drive up to the 11 floor snaking though each floor to get to the 11th floor, this is tedious if you take your auto out much. The room was nice, a suite, very clean, and quiet. I would not stay here again because I felt too enclosed and away from what I love about San Diego....the sun and the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - but the parking?”
Reviews.Author: StuckOnThe50
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Suites is a nice hotel near the Freeway. Stayed at this hotel on business and wanted to be within walking distance to PETCO field. Stayed for two nights on business. The room is large with a separate living room, television and desk from the bedroom. Large bathroom with separate sink area from the shower/toilet area. Fee for internet access in your room but there are computers available for free in the lobby area (4 computers). Rooms were clean with nice linen at what is a typical Sheraton. Hotel is a good 1/2 mile walk to the PETCO, Gaslamp, Convention Center. My biggest issue is the parking at the hotel. The ramps to get the guest parkings are tight and you weave throughout the parking lot. You will need to go to the 11th or 12th floor. I had a full-size car and was worried about scraping something. It took so long to get in and out on the second day I opted to park on the street instead of paying $22/day with the chance of scraping my rental car. If you are returning from dinner late and leaving early - ample free parking on the street (check the signs) or open lots. I found parking right outside the hotel the second night. Note: Lobby is located on the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel and everybody was so nice!!”
Reviews.Author: beaches2see
Reviews.Content: We would only be staying at the hotel for one day. It was nice and clean. The rooms are good size and comfortable. The staff was nice and made suggestions on meal options close by. Lots of shops within walking distance. Would certainly return back to stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay-it's an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: bw331
Reviews.Content: San Diego is a city of many great hotels and many more good hotels. This hotel does not fall in either category. It served my purpose just fine--I just needed a hotel for the night between flights and it was very very cheap on Hotwire. However, I wouldn't want to spend more than a night here. The people at the front desk were exceptionally nice. But the hotel is old and the rooms show it. You get a suite, so it's larger than a normal hotel room, but it is really showing it's age. The bathroom was particular aged. Also, it's not in a great location if you want to explore most of the city. I'd stay away. There are too many nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Spacious, Great Emaployees that Make You Feel Welcome”
Reviews.Author: ConVivo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply a great value. Very nice rooms that are true suites. The employees are seem to care that you really have a great stay and I have never had any issue with this hotel at all. 100% recommendation for location, service, and rooms. The restaurant and room service is typical - very expensive and not worth the cost. There are several great restaurants within a few blocks so take advantage of all that San Diego has to offer. The Sheraton Suites San Diego will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with issues”
Reviews.Author: bettyking
Reviews.Content: The Staff was excellent, but I have three magor beefs. First and foremost the parking!!! $22 and what a nightmare. I thought I was going to wreck my car gettingup a very small steep incline. DANGEROUS. Especially if you don't know what is going on. It should always be disclosed that there is a parking rate. The water bottles that said they were complimentary were only for preferred Guests which was not how the label read. Did not appreciate that or the parking fee. The hot tub was out, which was a big reason we picked a 3.5 star, very disappointing. I have stayed at this chain before and it was only rated 3 and it was no different than the other. Still very good!!! Comfortable, clean, and friendly staff. It would just be nice to know the issues ahead of time. These can be irritating factors that can ruin a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Goodies are what's only good here.”
Reviews.Author: classtraveler
Reviews.Content: Whats good? Location - Near the Gaslamp (a brisk walk) & right smack in Downtown. Still some distance from Petco and the other oceanside amenities. Goodies - in the Lobby in Am's - comp. coffee & Pms - house champagne, lemonade, and fresh baked cookies - tons of freeloaders embrace this time and bring their entire families with them! Also NO FREE WIFI, but Sheraton invites you to use their SLOW, VIRUS CRIPPLED Microsoft computers if you need internet access. Whats bad? Everything Else - Hotel looks pleasing at first glance, but it is the details which give this hotel, its lackluster feel. Cleanliness - From the elevators that need deodorizer to the missing cabinetry handles to the dirty, outdated hotel rooms, this hotel desperately needs a makeover. Convenience - Self Parking @ $22 and Valet @ $28. Word of advice, park on the street and expect to walk, there are private lots available for $10 a day. If staying @ this hotel, it will cost you as much as your room rental or more for parking on weekdays. Parking is a nightmare on weekends outside, your options might only be @ the hotel at that point. Cost - Marketed as a suite hotel, this place does not have the look and feel of a dignified hotel, although the staff tries really hard to pull it off. You have to go to one lobby, into one elevator, and travel to the 12 floor to check in to another lobby and into another elevator. Very annoying. Also, only one entrance and exit. Class - Certainly not a 4 star, maybe a 2 or 3 at the most. This is an aging property circa 1980s. The lobby and conference rooms are only whats going for it so far. There are better options elsewhere. Will I stay here again? Only if they pay me too or invite me back on the house. For the price, there isn't really much to expect from this hotel. As in the other reviews, the hotel is in a good location, near freeway access and the airport. But where it suffers is in the details that make a trip all the more pleasurable - Cleanliness, convenience, exorbitant parking, dated atmosphere, the list goes on and on. For a hotel bearing the Sheraton name and price included, there really isn't anything to be impressed about. As always, if you really have to stay here, ask for the rooms on the other side away from the buildings for a more pleasing view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: flounder0979
Reviews.Content: Really comfy beds, great location, good amenities. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites and pretty views -- pity about location, Internet”
Reviews.Author: techconfgoer
Reviews.Content: I booked a Sunday nite stay on Hotwire, which may explain the bargain $80 cost (also add another $15 in taxes). The suite was huge and clean. Bed was comfy. Views were fantastic from my 18/floor room. Downsides: - A few blocks away from the Gaslamp district, so it's quiet. - In-room wired Internet cost $12/day, and was very slow, hard to be productive. - Pool was tiny, hot tub was broken, and gym was tiny. - The ramp to the parking garage on floors 1-8 of this skyscraper was very tight, I'd be scared about scraping the paint on an SUV or bigger sedan.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't ask for much and got what I asked for”
Reviews.Author: RobertBrady1159
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel, I asked for a room away from ice and soda machines and to be able to check in at 1pm. Arrived at 2pm to check in, was informed no even though the girl at Reception didn't even bother to check my reservation status. I didn't say anything other than walk away. Upon returning I was given my room and you guessed it right next to the ice machine and elevator. Do they not read any of their quest requests. The parking is scary $22 per day for self parking 11 floors up though a very narrow drive. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again for their poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you come prepared”
Reviews.Author: thhtorah
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay quick summary: Pro's: location, rates, nice sized suite with french doors seperating the living area from bedroom, worked really well with kids. Staff was helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Good looking fitness room Cons: Valet -$28 but we were prepared for that No fridge in room (seemed to be a place for one but empty) very small shower stall no complimentary breakfast at all. even coffee and fruit would go a long way. Pool was cold and had a/c blowing down on it, badly designed I would recommend this as long as you come prepared for the above items.

Reviews.Title: “"SPG Free Weekend Night Reward - Room 2202"”
Reviews.Author: goriajk
Reviews.Content: I have to say, Starwood has probably the BEST PROMOTION for any hotel chain this summer. You stay two paid nights at any Starwood property (Sheraton, Westin. etc) and you receive a FREE weekend night stay along their hotel network. I used my free night at Sheraton Suites, San Diego for Sat. August 1st (My friend and I came down to see The Padres vs. Milwaukee Brewers at Petco). This property used to be 'Marriott Suites' and I stayed here back in 1998. I know Downtown SD very well, and was able to park on the street next to the COMERICA BANK Tower at 6th and A Street (Saturday after 6pm no metered parking until Monday morning) - My friend and I walked up just one block to the hotel entrance (Nice, Dude. No need for the $22 valet =). We took the elevator to the 12th floor, where the lobby is located. Link @ Sheraton was available from the lobby, nice wi-fi for my iTouch. Check-In was relatively fast and efficient - we got room #2202 (with great views of the SD-Coronado Bay Bridge!!!) Yes, it is smaller than a 'suite', the living area and bedroom separated by French Doors. Still, it served our purpose well, with a new sofabed couch and flat screen HDTV in the living area. For my fellow Padres fans out there, the walk is straight down 6th Street (about 15 mins.) and I couldn't suggest a better place to stay.
