The only negative would be to work on the bathroom in our room, otherwise it's a great choice. We did use the pool and spa on Sunday afternoon before our late checkout. The hotel's staff at this property were simply fantastic!!! I would most certainly return. Peace - JG 'Bear'

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but they nickel and dime on the extras.”
Reviews.Author: fallengoddess
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights during Comic-Con (a major geekfest held annually in San Diego). The room was lovely and quite clean. While it is probably not anywhere near the size of an actual suite at an upscale hotel, none of the descriptions had led me to believe it would be. It was larger than a single hotel room, and we enjoyed having a separate sitting room area rather than having to use the bed to read/watch tv. The layout was very convenient, especially when my boyfriend want to get up early and I did not - we just closed off the bed, and he could use the rest of the space for dressing, checking email, etc. They do charge extravagant prices for small amenities, however. "High-speed internet" was $10/24 hours and painfully slow. Self-parking was $22/night, and the spaces are very tight (although the entrance ramp is not the nightmare some people have claimed, just long and spiral-shaped). There was no continental breakfast and the lobby restaurant seemed pricy for the food type/location. We did not try the pool. The location was great for us - we walked all over downtown - but might be a bit of a hike for people not used to that. It's about ten blocks to the Gaslamp Quarter and a mile to the Convention Center. All in all, we had a great stay and would definitely stay there again - although probably not if we had to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: daydr23
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice however it did not offer any of the things a nicer hotel should. There was not continential breakfast, parking is extremely expensive, and you have to pay high dollar for any extras. The lobby was placed in an akward place where you had to switch elevators. It wasn't the stay we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to have a suite; location and staff only ok”
Reviews.Author: mjs7777
Reviews.Content: It seems like most of the strongly positive reviews of this hotel are from people who booked very low rates on Priceline. On its own merits, as a 3.5* hotel, this property did not match my expectations compared to other hotels of that class. At a deeply discounted Priceline rate, however, it was a good value. There were several questionable design choices in our king suite. The bed was a little too large for the bedroom, so that the bedroom doors would only close if pushed hard to squeeze past the bed. There were no easy-to-access power outlets near the desk. The kitchenette area had a stocked mini-bar but no refrigerator - just an empty, dirty cabinet space where one probably was in the past. Lots of little negatives that added up. The suite also had a mix of 1950's-style elements along with perhaps a partial renovation? For example, the dresser in the bedroom and the overall look of the bathroom were vintage, while the other furniture seemed more modern. In fact, the bathroom looked rather sterile and bland, while the rest of the suite was colorful. Overall, the suite looked sort of odd and disjointed. I was also unimpressed with most of the staff. At check-in, the clerk worked super fast, clearly giving the impression he wanted to get me out of his hair as quickly as possible. In fact, he kept making obvious attempts to end the conversation with me, even though I had several questions about the hotel. In addition, we had two separate one-night reservations and he did nothing to attempt to link them together or even verify the second reservation was in the system. Simply told me to come back to the desk the next day for new keys. We had a late night snack and drinks in the bar area. Food was delicious and service was fine but, again, felt rushed, as it was near closing time. There were several computers and a printer available for free use in the lobby, as well as wi-fi Internet access. While I appreciated the idea, the access was slow enough to be annoying. The location is about 10 blocks from the Gaslamp District. It's walkable on a nice day. On Friday night I found open metered parking on the side of the hotel but did not make it to the car early enough the next morning to avoid a ticket. (Though at $30, it wasn't much more than the parking at the hotel, anyway.) No problems on Saturday night, as metered parking is free all day Sunday. I don't think I'd choose to stay here again. There are plenty of nicer hotels closer to the center of the downtown action. However, I would be fine with winning this hotel again on Priceline. Definitely nice to have a spacious suite with an interesting view at a low price.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way, and in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: 1) This hotel is a bit outdated. The bathrooms have are outdated. There is a separate shower and bath and the shower has tiles that look like they are from the 70's. Wallpaper in room old looking/outdated. 2) VERY small for a suite. Basically just a room chopped in 1/2, maybe with a few extra square feet. 3) It is a bit outta the way unless you really enjoy walking alot. San Diego is not a huge downtown walking city, and this hotel is really at the edge of what I would call the center of the city. It is quite a bit of a walk to the "action" of the eateries and bars. 4) Staff has a lot to be desired. Seems like in general they are very aloof and non-caring. However, the staff in the Sky Lounge (which, by the way, has not even a glimpse of a view of the sky itself) is excellent. The wait staff and bar staff are attentive. They were the most helpful people regarding information about the local area. This hotel is good to stay at if you have 2-3 people that all need separate beds, b/c there is a pullout couch. Otherwise, I would choose the myriad of options that are much closer to the center of the "action" in SD. This hotel surely is not, and I would definltely not recommend this venue to anyone. If feels more like a high end Holiday Inn or a Crown Plaza than a Sheraton. This is a struggling 3 star hotel with little more than a decent gym and restaurant, outdated rooms, and relatively indifferent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: lovely622
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in March. I was very impressed. The hotel was maybe like 15 minute drive. It was easy to find. Its by the freeway exit. We took 5 minute cab ride to Gas Lamp district. Staff was friendly. Room was a bit small but liked the fact that the living room is seperate from the bedroom. The parking spaces are pretty small especially for a full size suv and they need more parking slots. Overall, I would certainly stay here again when we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel we will stay at again.”
Reviews.Author: JennGLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I wanted somewhere clean and nice to stay with my Husband and 3 year old that was close to Sea World. We also went to Legoland and the Concierge was very helpful in setting up a car service to take us there and back with a carseat in it. The hotel staff was very friendly, but the rooms were not as clean as I would have liked. I found some random hairs in 2 of the bath towels. The carpet had some stains and there was some hairs stuck in the bathtub drain. Housekeeping did not replace some of the towels or restock our coffee maker two of the three days we stayed. Our child slept on the fold out couch which made it very tight you actually had to step over the bed to get by. We were at the end of the hall room 1414 and on Saturday night the two rooms at the end with us, 1415 & 1416 had a big group of girls and guys staying there. They continuously went from one room to the other slamming the door shut everytime. Also hung out in fromt of the rooms and carried on loudly. My Hisband asked them nicely to please keep it quite that we had a child trying to sleep. About 45 minutes later everything picked back up again with a door slamming every 30 seconds or so, people running back and forth down the hall and loud talking and laughing again in the hall in fron of our door. We called guest services and explained the situaution to them, they apoligized and said they would handle the matter promptly. After 20 minutes and nothing had been resolved and doors still slamming, We called Guest Services again and demanded they take care of it or we would. It finally solved the problem until 8:00 am when they were back at it again. The next day we had a very tired little child and deffinatly would not recomend this hotel to anyone with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Sheraton Suites”
Reviews.Author: kumarv
Reviews.Content: Simply great... decent location, very nice staff, spacious rooms. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Parking is highway robbery”
Reviews.Author: Phillygirl109
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites, San Diego has an odd configuration. It's built atop a hill, so you have to drive 9 stories up a circular tunnel into the garage, take an elevator to the hotel lobby and then walk thru the restaurant to get to the bank of elevators that lead to the hotel rooms. Once you make it thru this maze, the hotel (although older)is quite nice. However be forewarned about PARKING. Because this is a business-district hotel, on-street parking is at a premium with stipulations for street sweeping and rush hour. Since this is quite the inconvenience, we chose to park in the garage at a rate of $22 per night!!!! I thought this was absurd and something Priceline should've warned me about. Had I known about this robbery, I certainly would have stayed elsewhere. The location is good, close enough to the Gaslamp Quarter and public transportation. Also short driving distance from San Diego Zoo, Legoland and LA by car. Sharman W Roslyn, PA

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your time or money!”
Reviews.Author: mkjuz
Reviews.Content: I decided I was going to become a member of TA because this hotel was so bad and I had to write a review. We stayed at the Sheraton Suites San Diego because it was close to the El Cortez (we were there for a wedding). On the 17th floor (not a mega member as I was not on the 25-26th floors, maybe those rooms are clean and nice). Carpet was dirty, tile floors in the bathroom had black hair all over the place, pillows were old and need to be replaced and the bed they rave about isnâ€™t all that. We had gone out for a few hours in the morning and thought our room would have been made up but housekeeping came by at 2:30pm and wanted to clean. We were able to get clean towels and more coffee/cups. Plus â€“ A cab is $12 from airport, and walking distance to Gaslamp Quarter. Hotel starts on the 12th floor so you walk in the lobby at street level, then up 12 floors, then in to another lobby and on to another set of elevators. Small water bottles in room are $3.50 each, breakfast buffet is $19 per person, and a 3-cup pot of coffee was $4.00 and NO refills! WAY overrated, WAY overpriced and WAY NOT worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: cinders19
Reviews.Content: I used price line and got $75/night. We stayed Friday & Sat. This hotel is close to airport. It was close enough to Gas Lamp District to walk, (4 blocks away). Friday night we strolled down to Gas Lamp District, 100's of places to go eat, drink, party. We stopped at Croce's Restaurant and listened to some jazz . And a few other places for drinks. Saturday we drove over to zoo, very close. We also drove the 59 mile scenic route thru San Diego. It is a beautiful place, very colorful. **Would recommend trying price line for this hotel, this is a good downtown location. The king size bed was very comfortable for me, my grown son sleep on sofa bed. French doors gave us privacy. **Parking was a slight inconvenience. The first night I used the parking garage and had to drive up to 11th floor for hotel parking. Office to check-in is on the 12th floor. We parked on the street saturday night for free. Walked a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: krbd2a
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is decent. Not close enough to the Gaslamp to walk, but just a cheap cab ride. The hotel was nice enough, not many amenities inside the hotel and the "Sky View" lounge does not have a single window in it. But all in all, a decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmberBock
Reviews.Content: This all suites hotel is very clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and gracious. We had particularly great experiences with the bartender in the lobby bar and the front desk staff. All rooms are legitimate suites, a living area with a nice flat screen tv and excellent work area. Comfortable bed in the bedroom and the bathrooms are nice. The pool and spa are indoors. The pool is great. The spa is a little small if you want to get more than 3 people in it. There is a gym and the cardio equipment is excellent. Minimal weights though, just one universal machine. We did not eat in the restaurant. A note about parking. The Sheraton shares the building with offices and the local symphony. Hotel parking is limited to the 11th level and it is a long, serpentine path to get there. Once you have parked you are quite close to the front desk but it takes some effort to get there. $22/day to self park feels expensive but it is in line with the area. There are alot of surface lots close by ranging from $10 - $12 per day. Getting a metered spot was not difficult but it is not worth feeding quarters in. Though metered parking is free on Sundays. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel if you are staying in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Smoked_Sausage
Reviews.Content: Needed a suite in San Diego b/c travelling with baby. Pricelined it with intent of getting the Sheraton Suites San Diego specifically for this purpose. Wound up paying 70$ per night + 22$ parking. The hotel location is ok in that it is downtown however there are better locations (i.e. near gaslamp/Seaport village walking path where the other large chain hotels are situated - Hyatt, Mariott). Had I paid any more for the hotel I would have been EXTREMELY disappointed. Can't believe that the general hotel rates were about 170$. Our room was on the 18th floor. The carpets were dirty/stained, the walls and popcorn ceiling had stains, the furniture was old/worn. There were some peanuts lying on the ground when we first entered the room seeming to indicate that the vacuuming job was not adequate. The grout in the bathroom was old/stained. The hotel website says that it is newly renovated but that must be an exaggeration or only at club level floors. This hotel is a bit decrepit. In the end, unless you really need a suite in Downtown San Diego I would not recommend this hotel. I would not recommend paying more than I did for this place. There are better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “More about the location”
Reviews.Author: rkkwan
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the recent reviews about its rooms. Nice and spacious. Sitting area has flat panel LCD (with a few local channels and the paid movies in HD); bedroom has older tube TV. My north facing room has decent view and can see planes on approach to SAN. My guess is that south-facing rooms will mainly see the office tower in the same complex. On the Monday I was there, the area was very quiet at night, but not unsafe. From the 5th Ave trolley stop, it is 3.5 blocks to the hotel, but note that "A" St is on a small hill, so there's an upgrade going up. The northern boundary of the Gaslamp District is 5th and Broadway, so it's 5 blocks from hotel. I did not try it, but at least during the day, it may be possible to go up the office tower from "B" street to the 12th floor where the two sides connect above the Symphony Hall. That would avoid climbing the hill. I didn't have a car, but saw several garages on 5th and 6th Ave, about 3-4 blocks from hotel, to the north. So, there are options if one find the parking rate a bit steep. There are several decent eateries on 6th Ave between "B" and "C" street, which is just 2 blocks away. San Diego downtown isn't that large. While I did ride the trolley sometimes, I have also walked through the whole Gaslamp District and back from hotel; and I have also walked all the way to the Santa Fe depot. So, while its location may not be the most central, it is also quite acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: msladyk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights during New Years Eve after our Mexican cruise. Hotel is just a few blocks away from the gaslamp quarter with all the bars/restaurants and also close to shopping mall. Rates were very affordable and the suites were very spacious, clean, and updated. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near San Diego Port”
Reviews.Author: willemchea
Reviews.Content: Booked using Priceline. The price was very good and the hotel was clean, contemporary, updated. We used the hotel to sleep over before heading on a cruise and the hotel was minutes away. Since the hotel is downtown, parking is NOT free. $22 self parking and $28 valet. There is street(meter) parking around the area so give that a try. The hotel is atop the symphony so you take an elevator from ground floor to the 11th or 12th, that's the lobby. Room was extremely spacious as it was s suite. Separate living room area with sofabed, LCD TV, desk, arm chair and bar area. There was a fridge stocked with drinks and some space to still put your own personal items in there. The bathroom doesn't quite match the updated look of the lobby and rest of the room. Not too many restaurants around but there were convenient stores, coffee places to pick up essentials. Would definitely stay here again for the same purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good Suites Hotel; great platinum treatment”
Reviews.Author: RedJon
Reviews.Content: Pros * Very large suite rooms, clean and orderly. Good views. * Excellent bath, separate walk-in shower * Plasma TV in main room * Great SPG platinum treatment: top floor, free internet, free breakfast (which was regular hotel fare, bacon/eggs, yogurt, fruits etc). * Free business center allows printing Cons * Driving up 11 floors to parking wasn't that bad, but $22 a night is a bit disappointing * Location is a little bit off restaurants etc if you are there for a vacation. It's very very business-y in the surrounding blocks (actually, I would prefer a closer location to gaslamp or beach even if I was on business) Overall, I would say this delivers exactly what's promised. Rates: booked for 3 nights using priceline name-your-own at 67 a night. Regular rate of 139 seems a bit excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Suites was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: Got a steal for this hotel on priceline.com for the Friday and Saturday following Christmas -- $53/night + taxes -- wow! I was pleasantly surprised when I checked in and realized I had a suite for this price... separate sleeping and sitting areas. The front desk staff were very helpful, and there were plenty of parking options so that I could avoid their >$20 parking fees at the hotel. On Sundays the meters don't run, so you're set there. Otherwise, I found a lot to leave my car in overnight for $14, I believe. I will be back again next month due to the great experience I had this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel, Not Sure Why Others Say Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: ken240
Reviews.Content: I got a room there for $70 a nite with Priceline and the parking costs $25 extra per day. Only thing I don't like is the parking, the driveway seems to be never ending, and really tests your driving skills. But later I noticed there was an independent garage across the street, you can try that. Get back to the main thing, the room was clean, the bed was comfy. You can also brew some free Starbucks coffee in your room, or use the microwave to heat up some leftover to heal your late nite craving. The staffs were nice too, and the lobby looks good too. The location is good, easy access to freeways and the Park. But if you're not driving, it's quite a long walk to the major attractions. I have no problem what so ever during the stay, and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Confusion”
Reviews.Author: Crysha
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Diego. I like suite-type hotels when I travel for business so that there's a separation of office from bedroom. I've stayed at a variety of Sheraton hotels, but this was one of the dirtiest I have experienced. I stayed at this hotel for 6 days. This hotel was selected by my company and I didn't have the option to change hotels. I'll address the confusion first: the elevators. Check-in and bell staff were very accommodating regardless of whether or not they were tipped. This hotel has a two different banks of elevators--one that takes you to the guest rooms and a second bank that allows you to exit/enter the hotel from the parking or street levels. I didn't have a car and it was quite inconvenient. Just something to note if you would rather have the convenience of getting on one elevator that can either take you all the way to your floor or to the street level; a personal preference I suppose. The suite had enough space for one person. It contained a large flat screen TV that was actually too large for the size of the living room area; plus you had to point the remote at a specific spot on the TV to get it to respond to commands. The beds were roomy, but the sheets were not very soft (I guess I've been spoiled by Hilton sheets). Now for the dirty part: The major problem I had was with the lack of cleanliness; particularly in the bathroom! It looked like a gorilla cleaned my bathroom every day because there was hair leftover in the tub, around the toilet and on the floor AFTER the room was cleaned! Plus, the floor was not ever vacuumed because there was a bottle top and a few crumbs on the floor in the same place every day. When I finally called to ask them to clean the bathroom better and vacuum, they sent housekeeping staff to my room around 9PM at night just as I was preparing for bed. Then, someone left food in my room on top of the microwave the next day. I don't need sparkle, but clean is a necessity and I was really disappointed with their service. I was in town for a conference, so did not spend a great deal of time in the hotel during the day, so when I came back in the evening I was too tired to address the cleanliness issue until the 3rd day of my stay. The hotel did try to respond, but not very well.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped”
Reviews.Author: Junipers
Reviews.Content: After travelling for 18 hours I arrived at just after 9pm to be told my room that had pre-paid for 6 weeks prior was not available and that the hotel was fully booked and they were moving me to a lesser Sheraton in Mission Valley. I chose the Sheraton Suites for its location close to the convention center and Mission Valley is a 20-30 minute cab ride. They have since reimbursed my extra cab fares, refunded the cost of my stay and for my personal inconvenienece the best they could do was to give a miserly 1500 Starwood points. I always seem to have some problems when I stay at a Sheraton on my global travels and they do seem to be a real weak link in the Starwood group. Needless to say I will not be stay at another Sheraton and I have posted my problems on our intercompany travel site and hope this will encourge some of our 30,000 people to also give Sheraton a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 Star plus”
Reviews.Author: FairwindTravel
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay. Cose to the cruiseship terminal and SAN airport. Hotel located on top of San Diego Symphony Hall, therefore lobby is not at street level but a short elevator ride up. Smallish lobby, efficient and friendly check in. Comfortable suite. Large. Separate living room with microwave, bar area with coffee and tea service,sofa and arm chair and work desk. Flat screen TV in living room. RJ45 connections at workdesk. Standard 9.95/day for internet. Bedroom with kingsize bed taking most of the room. TV. The double doors to the living room would not close due to size of the bed. Single sink and closet off the bedroom, leading to bathtub, separate shower stall and toilet. Access also from living room. Starwood bed and linens of good quality. Close to Balboa Par and the San Diego Zoo. Walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter. Solid 3star plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Suites”
Reviews.Author: bruinbud
Reviews.Content: We booked Sheraton Suites through Priceline for a one night stay, and was overall very satisfied with the Hotel. It's located in the north western part of downtown San Diego- which in my opinion is the ok, but much would prefer a location near Harbor or Horton Plaza. The check-in process was quick & easy. Front desk personnel was very helpful, they honored our request for a room facing Balboa Park. Room- the room was quite spacious, loved the french doors separating the living room from the bedroom. Having 2 TV's was nice. Bathroom was nice- had a tub and a separate small walk-in shower. Wallpaper in bath was somewhat outdated. Free internet access in lobby, small indoor pool and jacuzzi. Really nice, clean suite (bedroom furniture needing some TLC, but nothing major), great bathroom, good view, starbucks coffee (free), minibar and snacks (to be paid for). Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Only bad thing- $22/night self park.

Reviews.Title: “If they cleaned it I'd like it”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: Wow. Well the photos will show part of the issue. Staff was wonderful. I didn't encounter anyone that wasn't friendly and super helpful. Parking is a bit odd. It's just spiraling up & up & up. Could be worse I guess in theory, like maybe with a large vehicle. The problem was the actual room. Yes they're spacious, you have a fridge and a microwave. But disgustingly dirty. Our first room had hair everywhere. I don't know if it was ever actually cleaned, maybe just straightened. So perhaps you might say that they weren't aware that the person had checked out. Maybe but the amount of hair was just disturbing. We called down to the front desk and they actually sent someone up to move us. Well our move was next door. The room next door wasn't as full of hair but you could still tell they just didn't clean it well. You could see exactly where the tables had been wiped. It was just a shoddy job at best. The room itself needed help too. The drawer pulls were missing. Just strange things that showed the age on this place and the lack of maintenance. The shower was one of those "every way but down" types of showers. I've only posted the "hairiest" photos. I'll skip the finger nail, end of the plastic from a clothes tag, weird pieces of who knows what substance all of the the floors & counters. We had a nice view of downtown. The bed was comfy. Our Priceline price was right. Would I stay again? Not willingly unless I knew for sure things had changed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall- Satisfied with the Suites”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference for 2 nights. I was pleased with the service at the front desk and housekeeping (I got voice mail when I called housekeeping and hung up- and they called me right back asking what I needed). I appreciated having a suite over a standard hotel room for the extra space, though I was a solo traveler and didn't need it. Since this hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to the Gaslamp District with hotels right in that area for a similar price to what this hotel goes for, I don't know if I would stay here again (if I were traveling for pleasure) simply because of the location- it isn't close to anything. When I first arrived, I was told the closest place to grab a "quick" dinner was fast food down a couple of blocks, so I settled on room service- between the 20% gratuity and $3 fee added to the meal, it cost me $20 for a grilled cheese sandwich, fries and a soda! ouch! The fitness center is VERY small and stuffy, which was packed in the morning, as there were 4 different conferences going on. Had I known it would be packed (and barely any machines and no hand weights), I may have opted for the gym across the street for $7.50. As a hotel that caters to a business clientele (numerous conference rooms), I found the inadequate gym surprising.

Reviews.Title: “not up to Sheraton standard”
Reviews.Author: Jonavin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire knowing that this is the one I would get based on amenities and other indicators. I checked the other Tripadvisor reviews and saw the comments about noisy fans decided to book anyways. Overall the hotel isn't too bad. The location isn't the greatest; as far as downtown goes, it's at the wrong part of it IMO. Parking is a challenge going up 11 floors of narrow parking, or you can pay $32 for valet. The Bad: The fan noise is really annoying. The HAC noise is made worst by the fact that there isn't a temperature control. I can't remember the last time I've been to a 3+ star hotel that doesn't have climate/temperature controls. So what you end up with is a room that's either too cold or too hot, with lots of fan noise. The washroom fan noise is worst, sounding like a helicopter trying to take off. I've stayed at many hotels in San Diego, and while this isn't the worst of them, it's below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheSun2008
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton Suites through Hotwire and were very pleased with the Hotel. Check in / front desk very helpful and good with the kids. Bar staff very friendly and reasonably priced bar meals and happy hour for drinks. There were quite a few kids around and we didn't at any time feel uncomfortable having kids in this hotel. Free internet access in lobby, small indoor pool and jacuzzi. Room : The first 2 nights we stayed in a one bedded suite (one bedroom with queen bed and lounge with sofa bed). Really nice, clean suite (bedroom furniture needing some TLC, but nothing major), great bathroom, good view, starbucks coffee (free), minibar and snacks (to be paid for). We got moved to a 2 bedded suite for the 3rd + 4th night on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor for no extra charge - however the bathroom and the view in the standard suite were better. Good location - walking distance to the trolley and Gaslamp Quarter. Easy access to Balboa Park. Only downfall was the parking - $22 a day for self-parking - 11 floors up a narrow and twisty ramp - but handy to have. All in all, a great hotel stay which we could not fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bobshady86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 6/14 - 6/15 for my stay in San Diego to watch the 2008 US Open. Finding the hotel is no problem but parking was a little hassle. You have to park on like the 7th floor or something like that and to get up there you have to go up a twirling driveway. Interesting setup however it is downtown San Diego and parking is hard to find. Not anything huge, just wanted people to know how the setup is. I checked in around 7 pm. For having elite status in their Starwood program, they gave me a club level room but the club room is not open on weekends which really disappointed me. However, they gave me 2 breakfast vouchers to a fancy restaurant that ajoins them. The suite was big and obviously had a living room and a separate bedroom with a bathroom. Looked very nice and was very cozy. A lot of standard amenities and everything was very clean. No complains about the room. Had a great sleep because it was very quiet. Woke up early the next morning and ate the breakfast buffet with the coupons. It was very delicious and the best breakfast I got at a hotel. Checked out with no problem. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good outweighs the bad by quite a bit”
Reviews.Author: cras108er
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Suites for 9 days in June 2008. Overall, I would say our experience was positive. I think most people would find the accommodations more than satisfactory. If you lean toward the finicky side, you may find some minor discrepancies. Here is our assessment of the pros and cons: Pros: Price: We booked at priceline.com. We paid $100 a night, but feel like we may have still overbid somewhat - especially for the time of the year. The hotel did not appear to be full. Customer Service - We found the staff to be VERY friendly and helpful. We arrived at 10:00 a.m. and were allowed to check in early. They showed us two rooms (one with a corner view and one without) and let us choose. We chose the one without the corner view. The configuration of the rooms made the non-corner room appear larger, although it wasn't really.. Every evening as we came in, we would receive a "welcome back" greeting from the staff. Configuration - You basically get a bedroom, a living room, a kitchenette/bar area (although it is just a microwave and refrigerator), a bathroom (with separate shower/tub, and the toilet behind a privacy wall), and a sink and closet in a separate enclosed area. As you can see the suite is relatively large (think twice the size of a standard hotel room). We had a king bed, so there was plenty of room in the bedroom, although I could see where two full size beds would be a little cramped. I liked the frosted french doors between the living room and bedroom. Tow couples or a family could definitely use it - although storage space is a bit limited. View - The hotel is on the twelveth floor, so all of the rooms have views. We were on the 22nd floor. We had a view of the city that extended out to Balboa Park. You could also see the harbor if you turned your head just right. There were planes coming in for a landing, but as other reviewers have said, you couldn't hear them. I think the 24: and 25th floors were for Starwood Preferred Members and the 26th and 27th floors were for Club members, although there there isn't much difference in the rooms from what I understand. Location - Depending on your fitness level, you could pretty much walk to the zoo, Balboa Park (where the museums are) the Gaslamp District, and the docks. You can take a train to Tiajuana very easily. The trolley runs just two blocks from the hotel. Having a car is an added convenience though if you want to get out and explore. Computer Access - There are four computers in the lobby with free internet access. You have to pay for internet access in your room. It was fairly easy to get time on the computers. Sometimes you had to wait a few minutes, but never very long. Facilities ; There is a nice pool, with a fairly large deck area. The pool isn't very big, but what do you expect from a hotel. It is on the 12th floor and has large picture windows on one side, so you get a nice view. The exercise room appeared to be well equipped. Yes, you have to walk across the lobby to get to the pool, but there is also a locker room area and a bathroom for those who are a little more modest. Nothing to complain about. CONS (and all of these are pretty minor): Decor - My wife felt lke the decor was a bit dated. Bear in mind that it was not bad. It looked like the place has been fairly well maintained. The room furniture looked like it had absorbed a bit of wear and tear. They are in the process of updating. Our room even had a flatscreen TV in the LR with great reception. Cleanliness - I'd rate clanliness as 3.5 - 4 stars. It looked like the maid only emptied trash and made the bed. Overall, it was fairly clean, but it didn't seem like they vaccumed, or did a good job cleaning sinks, etc. during our stay. Parking - I have to mention this, since every one else has. In my opinion, "it is what it is." The only thing I would say is to make sure you rent a small vehicle. We had a little subcompact and had no problem, but we did see some people with larger cars struggling to get their vehicles into the small spaces. They would do well to make the parking diagonal, rather than pull in. Yeah it cost $20 per night, but that's what it cost. There is virtually no parking downtown, so that's what it costs. It actually cost us more to park our rental car than it did for the rental fee, but we're glad we had it. My overall assessment is that it is not as bad as others are making it out to be, but we also had a small car. Refrigerator - Well, its not really a refrigerator. It is a drink cooler that doesn't keep things very cool. They will provide you a refrigerator, for an additional fee of $30 per night (no thanks). Yeah, we called them and asked them to come take a look - something I don't think they ever did, but so what? Area: The area around the hotel is commercial. It is about 2-3 blocks from the gaslamp district. So, at night, it can be a little dark and relatively deserted. My wife and I walked back and forth regularly at night and never feared for our safety. I wouldn't recommend a woman walk it alone. There are a fair number of "street people throughout all of downtown San Diego, but I never saw a problem with any of them - not even panhandling. My personal pet peeve - It seems as though the more "upscale" the hotel the less amenities you provide. They had snacks in the room for astronomical prices. You had to pay for in room nternet. Someone said you're even charged for local phone calls. You can go to a Hampton Inn and get all of that for free, plus get a free breakfast too - all for a lower price. Go figure. As you can see, when I'm on vacation, I'm a "no worries" kind of guy. Was it perfect? No. But I have stayed in much worse. Life is too short to sweat the small stuff. I would definitely stay here again. That's my story and I'm sticking to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oaklay18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for a work trip. This isn't the closest to the convention center, however if I were to go back for personal reasons I'd stay again. The layout of the room makes it feel very spacious and the bathroom is huge with a sepearte shower stall and bath tub. The bedroom has doors which is nice if traveling with family and need privacy. The staff is very friendly and room service was good. Everything you expect from a starwood hotel. There are a lot of great hotels all within a few blocks, but again I'd go back. Try The Fish Market for dinner. Excellent seafood.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: mwfiesole
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't believe this was under the Sheraton umbrella. Cleanliness was an issue. The first room I was given had berries rolling the floor and stains on both the couch and carpet. I asked for another room and the building manager first brought the cleaning staff into the room to inspect while I was still there. I didn't find that process professional, the staff was essentially reprimanded in front of guests-not good. The next room I was given seemed ok on the surface, carpet needs to be replaced but there were no glaring cleanliness issues so I settled in, to find when I pulled the bedding back something that looked like a large amount of dried tomato sauce on the bed skirt (and the floor and the wall). They couldn't move me, but changed the skirt and cleaned the floor the next day. It just didn't feel comfortable at all with that kind of filthiness going on. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff and Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: LA_Neener
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in town for the San Diego Rock & Roll Marathon the last weekend of May/first of June. The staff was incredibly accommodating - changed my room from one by the elevator to one with a corner window and great view, set up a very late checkout to ensure I would have time to come back and shower and clean up after the race, and very polite valet staff that never lingered "waiting for a tip." Actually, my boyfriend had to follow one of them back to the stand to hand him the tip. . .the gentlemen walked away too quickly after handing over the keys and putting the luggage in the car. The room was spectacular - the view was great, the bed was comfortable, and I enjoyed having a separate room with couch and tv apart from the bedroom. The location is great. I was able to walk to the starting line at Balboa Park and it is a short walk to the Gaslamp District. It is a very central location and I highly recommend booking here if you'll be in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ralphie2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one night only, and do not have anything bad to say about it (contrary to many other hotels we stayed at.) The room was specious and clean, bed was comfortable, and the view of Coronado Bridge and downtown was spectacular. The stuff was very professional and friendly. We requested additional pillows and a sawing kit, both arrived immediately. The food we ordered from the room service was fresh and tasty. We stayed at the club level which seems to make a lot of sense â€“ you get a room of the 26th or 27th floor, complimentary drink and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Would be lovely only if...”
Reviews.Author: smmrtravel
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty hotel in a great location, but it didnt seem very clean. I was turned off by the musty/mildew smell from the bathroom and I couldn't even take a shower there after I saw the hair on the soap dish (which was still there when my co-worker checked into the same room the next day). All in all the hotel was nice the conference rooms were very nice also. If you don't mind dirty bathrooms, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: MickeyD777
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant 5 day stay in February. The hotel staff is wonderful and easy to work with. I had boxes arriving and they went out of their way to accomodate them and then deliver them. Food was very good. We used the banquet staff for a few meals and they were great to work with and the food was great. The chef really went out of his way to make things look and taste great. It was expensive but the quality and service was great. The bar was nice and the bar staff was great. They were friendly and helpful in every way. Housekeeping staff left a little to be desired. They came at different times every day and really did not do much besides exchange towels and throw the covers back on the bed. Room was very pleasant (two rooms). Bed was comfortable. Everything was in good working order. View was fun watching the airplanes come in over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms/Awful Restarant”
Reviews.Author: ckg88
Reviews.Content: This downtown Sheraton has comfortable suites although the pool set up is a little odd (You have to go through the formal lobby to get to and from it.) The real disappointment is the restaurant. We went down for breakfast and the waitress suggested the brunch. It was nicely set up but when we went up to serve ourselves, there was no food. Everything was empty except for a couple of little boxes of dry cereal (no milk). We asked the waitress who said they were cooking everything and it would just be a minute. Forty-five minutes later, still no food, I asked for the manager who said, "The cook is out buying more food to cook. What exactly did I want?" No apology, no offer to waive any part of the bill. Over $80 for two cups of coffee and a piece of toast. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton figured out how to do it right.”
Reviews.Author: mothnm
Reviews.Content: You can't help but notice a large trophy on the twelfth floor lobby desk of the Sheraton. The staff is proud of their service and intend to keep the trophy by staying friendly, keeping the rooms clean and attractive, providing internet access/boarding pass printouts in the lobby, taking care of problems right away such as replacing batteries in the TV remote. There is one set of elevators from street level to the lobby and a second set from the lobby to the rooms. Reminded me of Tokyo hotels that occupy a few floors of a high rise. Always wanted to stay in one and now I feel like I have. We hung out for a little while in the small lobby sipping complimentary lemonade. Central location. Weekend street as well as hotel interior parking. It's a new hotel and Sheraton figured out how to do it right. The suites are very well designed to maximize space while providing kitchen area, sitting area, sleeping area, desk and bathroom with tub. Coincidentally a friend was staying at the hotel the same nights we did. We were all raving about how nice the hotel was. Nice workout room on the rainy day. Quick drive up 163 to Balboa Park for a run on the sunny day. There were very small problems such as occasionally hearing our neighbors and dry air.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereWorcester
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend. Booked using Sheraton points and cash. Check-in was a breeze! Room clean, large suite with king bed and fold-out couch. Fabulous shower! Free internet a nice perk. Breakfast a little pricey, but the bar area and available snacks/pub food reasonable. Didn't have a car, so parking was a non-issue. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: drk13
Reviews.Content: Got a sweet deal 75$ thank you priceline! Stayed there for 4 days. Great location, really central, 5 minutes by car from Balboa park, 15 minute drive from the Coronado. 30 minutes from Encinitas, La Jolla, Oceanside. Great room, king size bed, separate bathroom, toiletterieroom, bath and then shower. I have to say the water pressure in the shower was amazing practically a steam bath, very relaxing. The pool, gym and jacuzzi were great. The staff was friendly and efficient. Room service even fixed me a plate of cheese and fruit that wasn't on the menu. The clientele is mostly business people. You don't have to valet park if you arrive after 8pm but check the parking signs. Basically you have to move the car or put quarters after 8 am. Valet parking is also good if you are feeling lazy because if not there is plenty of parking around. The staff is helpful at explaining the things to visit. Honestly I don't get the craze about the gaslamp district, its really ALRIGHT. I'd much rather go surfing in Encinitas, stroll for a romantic walk on the beach near the Coronado Hotel, or checking out La Jolla and the little restaurants and shops in the area. Definately visit the museum in Balboa park. You can check out Pacific beach but its kinda ghetto. Very good hotel, clean, good service, great location. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amontal
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline (60$ a night), great hotel, great location (2 blocks from Gaslamp area), great staff. 2 issues: Parking - at the 11th floor of the building thru narow entrance and 20$ a night. Breakfast - excelent but 20$ a person.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Understand their managment”
Reviews.Author: exoram
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend a weekend in San Diego with the family and decided to book my room at the Sheraton Suites. From the website, it looked perfect, and a suite for the family would be great. Got to the hotel and had a very friendly valet driver valet the car, so for it was starting out great. Now this is where everything just gets horrible. I go to the 12th floor which is the lobby and wait in line to check in. I booked a room with two double beds as i have 5 people in my party, 2 adults and 3 little children. The front desk clerk advises me that they only have rooms with a single king bed available. Now a little irritated i show them i reserved a room with two double beds. Now front desk clerk tells me that apparently on their website they have fine print stating that bed types are just a request and are not guaranteed. However he said he would put in a rollaway bed at no additional charge. So again let me be clear, he told me he has no rooms with 2 double beds available and will give us a rollaway bed at no additional charge. So now i begrudgingly accept the room as i need a place to stay. We get to the room and notice its pretty tightly packed. I have no idea where they will fit the rollaway. Housekeeping comes to the room to deliver the rollaway and then after about 15 minutues of trying to figure out where to keep the bed, tell us that our room is too small to put a rollaway in . So now we dont get a room with 2 double beds and housekeeping is telling us that they cannot fit a rollaway bed in the room. Now im pretty angry and go to the front desk and demand to speak to the manager. Believe it or not this is what he says to me. He understands my anger and b/c of that he will give me a room with 2 double beds. Why couldnt they just give me the room with 2 double beds to begin with ?? He had no answer and then i just couldnt stay at this hotel any longer, so i told him i will not be staying and will not be paying a penny for their horrible service. Another problem, he then informs me that i prepaid (which i did not) and i will get no refund. After getting angrier than i have in my life and 30 minutes later he realizes that we never prepaid, doesnt apologize and we walked out of the hotel and checked in to the embassy suites next to seaport village. ONE OF THE WORST EXPERIENCES OF MY LIFE. I just cant understand the management and how they can be so shady.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid priced hotel in San Diego Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: old_motters
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with some interesting quirks. The hotel lobby is on the 12th floor, you need to take the elevator past all the parking floors to reach it, then a different set of elevators to your room. Check in was friendly and smooth. In the lobby are free internet terminals and comfy sofas. Also on the 12th floor is the fitness room which was never busy when I used it with several good machines, and a small pool and jaccuzi. Pool is not really big enough to swim in but fine for cooling down etc. The hotel bar is comfortable and offers a decent happy hour ($4 margaritas!) with a nice selection of snacks. The suites are awesome. On the 24th floor we had a view of the flgith path into San Diego airport, not a problem and we rarely heard aircraft noise over the airconditioning. The bedroom is behind glass doors, and is a small but pleasant room with its own tv and window. The lounge is bigger than the bedroom and has a sofa, desk and small kitchen area where there's a countertop and a microwave. Fridge is available on request and incurs a small fee IIRC. Bathroom looks old but isn't. It was always spotless with a seperate (excellent) shower and bathtub. Only issue is parking. Either pay $20 for self parking, or $25 for valet. Self parking is arduous, up an enclosed spiral concourse for 7 levels before reaching parking and then another 4 levels before reaching hotel parking so we used valet after 1st night. No parking really available nearby so you are kinda captive. Overall, excellent hotel, and would happily use again and recommend but take into account the need to use valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “It's Reasonable for a Downtown San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits on top of the San Diego Opera House. We made a big mistake and parked our own car rather than valet. The parking is so bizarre! You wind up through this horrible twisting ramp all the way up to the 10th floor. If you are going to stay here just valet. The rooms are real nice. They have a nice big bed and a nice sized bathroom with a smaller suite area. It is best to get a room with a king bed - the double beds make the suite feel much smaller. We had a nice view. The hotel staff is very nice and they were always helpful. The odd thing is that this hotel doesn't seem to be located in that great of an area. We walked around a lot and it is a little seedy. However I thought the price was reasonable for staying downtown and the rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Sheraton Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Spudsmama
Reviews.Content: We had to evacuate due to the fires in San Diego county. We have a dog who is the world's biggest baby, so we couldn't go to a shelter that would separate us from her. We called several hotels that were not accepting pets, so we were relieved when the Sheraton said they were a pet friendly hotel. We told them we were evacuating, and they told us to come right down. Our suite was very nice, if a bit snug for a family. Great set-up for a business traveler or a couple. We headed into the restaurant, which was slammed with all the other evacuees. We walked to grab a pizza, but went into the bar for a drink later. Turns out lots of the staff had stuck around to work, and our "waitress" was an assistant manager. We also talked to two other employees in the lobby, both of whom were staying in the hotel due to the fires. I just thought that was very nice, since obviously the hotel could have sold the rooms that they gave to those employees. Also, they had milk and cookies in the lobby for kids, and dog biscuits for the dogs:) It was interesting to watch the dog parade from the lobby. There were 4 computers in the lobby for free internet access, which was helpful for those of us trying to keep up with the situation near our homes. I think the hotel really stepped up and did the right thing for its neighbors in San Diego. Since I live here, I don't stay in hotels in San Diego, but I wanted to post a report for anyone looking for a hotel here. I didn't check out the pool area, and thankfully, after reading the other reviews, we did do valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Lee1030
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the Hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The service was excellent until we went down to pick up our car from valet parking after we checked out. We checked out early to beat the rush. We called down to have our car ready. When we got there, the car was in front. I gave the ticket to the valet and waited. No one ever came over with my keys. I went back and asked the same valet about my keys twice and he asked if I had my ticket. I told him that I already gave it to him and he said ok. He finally found them and handed them to me without looking up rom what he was doing. Not the type of valet service you would expect for $25 per day. The suite was clean but very small in my opinion for a suite. The room was remodeled but several old fuxtures remained (sprinklers, thermostat, wooden bedroom furniture). Two of the drawers on separate fixtures were missing handles. Some of the wood on other furniture thorought the suite had large pieces missing that had broken off. These obviously had not been replaced during the remodel. The "sweet" bed was comfortable but for some reason the comforter kept pullng toward the foot of the bed during the night and fall off completely if you were not laying on a portion of it. The indoor pool and workout room were nice and clean. We used both during our trip and were very satisfied. The restaurant was very nice but had a very limited/ expensive menu. There were no kid friendly menu items so we ventured out to find somewhere to eat in the gas lamp district. The hotel was not what I expected based on the pictures but the $110 per night that I paid was a good price for any suite. However, I will stay somewhere else during my next vacation to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “good good!”
Reviews.Author: mondo12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week and was very happy with it, we had a nice sized suite and the good old sheraton bed never lets you down. Good location,although i did have bad experiences with bums and pushy homeless people outside both hotel entrances. The hotel is walking distance to gas lamp district and horton plaza shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice view, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: julianmom
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for 4 days. Pros: The hotel is situated in a great location, walking distance to ballpark, and many restaurants/bars and public transportation, staff very friendly and helpful, we had a very nice view of San Diego, the room had a refrigerator/microwave. Cons: Awkward shower. The bathroom separates the tub from the shower. The shower stall is very small and there is only a tiny space for your toiletries. You can only fit a bar of soap! No place to place a washcloth, shampoo, razor, etc. Not to mention, you are always at risk of hitting the shower door open. Cleaning was mediocre at best. Toiletries and were not replenished, only some towels were restocked, we found one of the pillow cases had lipstick on it , the bathroom was clearly not mopped. Parking is VERY expensive. We parked on the street and had to go out in the morning to add quarters to the meter. I also did not like having to switch elevators. I don't think I'd stay here again, unless we get a great deal. If we ever return to San Diego, I'd like to try other hotels before I go back to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites over Labor Day weekend for $90 per night on Priceline. It was very much like Embassy Suites except for no free breakfast or cocktails. It was great having the extra room in case someone wanted to read or watch TV and not wake the other person up. Thanks to Trip Advisor, we knew not to use the self-parking, and the valets always retrieved our car within ten minutes with no problems. The gym was small but adequate. The location was very convenient to everywhere in San Diego we wanted to go, with very easy freeway access and about 15 minutes' drive to the airport. The restaurant and bar were fine - I did not think they were overpriced. They have four (maybe five) free internet terminals in the lobby, and we always got on with no difficulty. My only quibble was the gift shop had weird hours and we could not buy a newspaper on a Sunday afternoon because the gift shop was closed. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: canadianexpert
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotwire for 5 of us great value for the summer season. After reading the last few reviews was a little nervous. The trip was Aug 18-21 and was exactly what we expected. We valeted, $25 a day, the whole trip and don't understand why anyone would come on here and and complain about self parking with all previous reviews. As long as one calls ahead there were no problems as the car was there each time.Valet offered directions each time and they park the car off-site The only hiccup in the trip was the bellman did not get our luggage to the room until a second call to the front desk. We had a north facing room and could see the planes landing, my kids loved watching, but we heard no noise. The pool, on the 12th floor, is on the small side but fit our needs for a 2 and 5 yr old. Check in was quick and efficient as was check out a bill slipped under the door, bed was a little firm for our tastes but most hotels we've stayed at are also too firm for us. Suite was decent sized, agree with another reviewer cable was fuzzy. We did not use in room dining but prices were comparable to other hotels as were the mini-bar prices. the location was perfect for the zoo, sea world, old town and the fish market. Don't know if I would be comfortable walking with the wife and kids, a lot of homeless, but a car is need to get around S.D anyways. Would stay here again with a great deal on hotwire,hotel was id'd through betterbidding.com so I knew what I was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: SanTanArizona
Reviews.Content: Ok, so when you arrive your like ' Wow, Look at that building!'. The outside is pretty (granite and gold and connected to Symphony hall and located near everything... impressive right?). Then you attempt to park your car :-0 !!! Don't do it! Go directly to the valet because that is who you will use for the rest of your stay! To get in the garage you go up this narrow winding tunnel for about 11 floors! SO Scary!! When you finally get to the garage you would figure the hell is over and you can finally park your car and go to your room, right? Wrong! The parking spaces are narrow as well and so are the lanes to drive past them! Anything bigger then a Geo Metro or Golf Cart is going to have a hell of a time parking! My husband managed to park our Lincoln Towncar after alot of stress (still don't know how he did it... I'm impressed!) and as soon as we got out of the car we heard several other people complaining (several of them with small cars). Anyway it was a Nightmare! Then we headed to the lobby to check in... (you have to get on two seperate elevators every time you go to your room!). When we got to the front desk they thought it was funny that we even managed to park and we immediately signed up for valet parking at $5 extra making parking $25 :-0.... Not Including tipping the valet $5 each time he gets our car! (If he is driving it up and down that spiral... he totally deserves more!!!) Then we finally get to our room and for about 30 minutes, we experience the ooooh and aaaah of look at that view and look at this living room and look at the seperate tub and shower, 2 tv's and french doors leading to the bedroom and microwave and mini bar and room service and so on. Then after being there for about an hour all the awefulness starts kicking in! Two elevators to get our luggage (should have had them bring it... I know that now!). Every time we walked past the front desk (which you will do ALOT since you have to walk past it to get to the second elevator!) the employees were screwing around like little kids! On one occassion I heard them making fun of a guest loudly... totally unprofessional! Then back to the room.... The big blue velvet couch was pretty to look at but when you sat on it, it was very uncomfortable and made a crunchy noise like it was full of newspaper! The desk was all beaten up like it came from a used store! They had food and beverage items in the room that you pay for, which I am ok with but the prices were nuts! $3.50 for a bottle of arrowhead, $3.50 for a kit kat, $3.50 for a little bag of peanuts, $7.00 for a can of beer. Thats all I remember but anyway... nutty prices! The wallpaper was falling off and had a big brown streak across it in the living room (not even curious to know what that was!). The toilet had either a drop of pee or blood on the seat and from there I noticed that the bathroom wasn't clean! When maid services came... was it clean after they came? NOPE! Still dirty in fact they didn't even vaccume (I know because something was still on the floor) and I later found a card that said if you want your sheets changed place this on the bed..... was it placed on the bed before I got there? Who Knows! The sheets were the cheapest most ichy sheets I have ever layed on ($1.99 value at most!), the rest of the bedding was cheap as well. Fancy shampoos and lotions provided? Nope.... Panteen Shampoo and Vasoline Lotion with the Sheraton logo on the other side (good thing I brought better with me! ). The shower had one of those old cloudy glass doors and pink tile and mold everywhere! The shower head leaked badly! The bathroom floor was always wet! When you took a shower in that pink, moldy, dark little closet ... you could here loud trucks driving by on the other side of the wall (I was on the 17 floor). I thought a fridge would be included.... only if you pay extra and request it! This hotel is all about charging you for everything they possibly can! I am surprised toilet paper and pantene were free! Although I wouldn't care to stay at this hotel again.... (I stayed for 2 days) the valet was extremely nice and helpful! The outside of this hotel will impress and so will the lobby if the employees aren't present >:( and this hotel is in a great location! Walking distance from Gaslamp Quarter (which has tons of dining options), Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, the boat that takes you to Coronado Island and Seaport Village! And only about a 10 minute drive from Sea World. You could almost get away with coming here with no car (would also save you on parking, valet, etc) because there are trolleys and a train nearby. This hotel charges about $199.00 a night I believe and I paid about $94.00 a night (Not Including Parking @$25.00 a night plus tips) through Hotwire. Sadly I still feel ripped off >:( !!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: prinkyss
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sheraton directly so that I could ask a few questions from the staff. The booking process was fine and my questions were answered, however incorrectly. For example, I asked if there was a fridge and microwave and was told there was. However, upon arrival they ask if you would like a key to the mini-bar. You need this key to open, not a fridge, but a "chiller." We were advised not to store anything that needed to be kept fresh or to store medication. It was also full of goods that we would have had to remove to store anything. I asked for a fridge and they wanted to charge an additional $30 a day on top of charging for paking and $20 per hour over the check-out time. They were gouge-happy and not at all accomodating. Our room had a broken lamp, broken drawer hinges and knobs as well as the toilet paper roll literally hanging off the wall by one, loose screw. For the price and location I would have expected better attention to detail. The parking was outrageous. We had more than one vehicle at $20 a day and I don't even think they checked to see which vehcles are hotels guests or employees to the neighboring tower. You might even be able to get away with not paying the parking fee. Our guests did. The room was smaller than expected. It was however, very quiet. Bottom line? Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth of July in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: letstalktravel
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites is located on the corner of 7th and A Street. We stayed here for two nights for Fourth of July. The parking from the reviews I've read here all are true! It's kinda wicked how you drive up into the parking structure! The opening is very narrow and the spiraling climb gets you dizzy after going up. There is no actual parking garage floor until you've reached the 7th floor, but please note that you are only allowed to park on the 11th and then if that floor is full then you're allowed to park on the 10th floor. We did see a Nissan Titan in this structure and kudos for that person who took the risk up and down that darn parking structure! The corner suite we got was on the south side on the 21st floor. We got a view of the Coronado bridge and city lights which was a nice romantic touch and a big plus for a view. The room is very spacious. The shower head needs more pressure and the down feather pillows are not my favorite (I like firmer pillows) and the clarity of their TV cable needs some fine tuning but that's all the complaints I could have about the room. The morning of check out was easy since we booked thru Hotwire and it was paid in full weeks ago ($106/night). The parking bill I found slipped thru the door was incorrect. They charged me for valet ($25) but I self parked ($20). The front desk gave me no hassle and they fixed the problem very quickly. Overall I'd probably stay here again for the downtown convenience factor. Also, the fireworks show from Seaport Village was AWESOME! It was like having 4 shows in one since they had barges all down the entire habor! A must see for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton...SWEET!”
Reviews.Author: wguy00
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending two nights/three days at the Sheraton Suites. I've stayed at more than a few 3 and 4 star hotels, but this was probably the best experience I've had. The staff was excellent. They answered all of my questions about San Diego immediately, and if they didn't know the answer (what time does Sea World close today?), they will look it up for you. Self parking was a pain. I would recommend paying the extra $5/day for the Valet parking. Valet was also very quick and courteous, offering directions whenever I retrieved my car. The room was nice, with plenty of room to stretch out. The shower door didn't do all that good of a job of holding the water in. It just seemed poorly designed. But other than that, I would highly recommend a stay at the Sheraton Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Flipje67
Reviews.Content: This was my last hotel on a combined business/holiday trip in the San Diego/Palm Springs area and I have to say I was most impressed by this hotel relative to the W and Westin (former Wyndham, not Horton Plaza). Nice sized suite accommodation in good condition. Friendly and efficient check in. No bike parking, so I was allowed to take it to the room for security overnight. Very comfortable bed (Sweet Sleeper!) so that was expected. Good bathroom, with separate shower and bath. Really couldn't fault the hotel - although note I did not make use of any other facilities than the room. Would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, clean, and reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: HeavenIsZambia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January 2006 at the Sheraton Suties San Diego. I was in town on business and the service at this Sheraton was really impressive. Most downtown hotels in San Diego are overrun by conventions or other big corporate meetins, but not this hotel. Service at the lobby bar was terrific, too. My room was recently renovated and was super clean and comfortable. Parking is a bit pricey ($23 a night) but that is about standard for San Diego now. When heading to SD, consider the Sheraton Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in January. Hotel was easy to find. We were dropped off by our car rental company so didn't have to deal with the parking nightmare. Quick easy check in at 1pm. Walked to the shopping district for shopping and dinner. It was a little iffy walking back after dark at 6:30 pm. Encountered a couple homeless people talking to themselves, a guy who came up and tryed to sell me jewerly, and watched polic make an arrest. Son enjoyed swimming in the small pool on the 12th floor. Room was on the 20th floor. Yes it is an older location, but the room was clean and plenty big with nice views. There was a note in the room saying they are currently remodeling floor by floor. Bed was quite comfortable and hated leaving it for morning flight! We could see planes landing but airport noises were not an issue. We got a cab to airport for $12. I would stay here again, but not walk after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: turtlez
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a trade show and booked this hotel because of its location and price. The hotel lobby is on the 12th floor of the building. Self-parking ($20/day) is on the 11th floor and is reached via a narrow spiralling ramp....it's almost like a Disneyland ride....don't attempt it in a large SUV! (use the valet). The suites are large and nicely furnished. The beds are large and very comfortable with wonderful bedding. Bathrooms are older, but functional, and would benefit from some updating. The hotel bar has a nice happy hour, but try to avoid the restaurant. Pricey and food is typical hotel food....nothing special. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: carolynk
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. It's located very conveniently off the highway. We paid $219 per night plus tax and $20 per night parking. When we booked, there was a special from Starwood for $15 off per night that they referred to as a "gas discount" (since gas prices have gone up??). Of course, when we received our bill under the door, this discount was not listed. When I went to the front desk to ask about it, the man was aware of this discount but tried to tell me it was per stay, not per night. I insisted, he called someone, and we got that straightened out. Why wasn't it on there in the first place?? I expect more of a hotel for that money. The room's decor was very dated (1970s??). The bathroom sink was cheap "cultured marble," it definitely wasn't real marble, and there was a crack running through the middle of it. There is no excuse for that at any hotel. A few days before arrival, I called to request a rollaway bed since my kids can't sleep together on the pull-out. The man told me there would be a $20 charge per night, but then he saw that we are Starwood Preferred guest members so he told me there would be no charge. Upon check-in, I had to argue with the woman at the front desk about this. The parking charge of $20 per night is obscene. They argue that the garage doesn't belong to them, they are simply renting. We made it up to the 11th floor each time without a scratch (amazing), but it felt very claustrophobic. Even when you get to the 11th floor, there's not much room, and the parking spots are tiny and scarce. There are signs everywhere that hotel guests are only allowed to park on the 11th floor, but if you return to the hotel in the evening, there aren't any spots left on the 11th floor!! My husband tried to park one night in the only spot left, and there was some minor crunching of bumpers before he finally gave up. We complained to the front desk, they moved our car for us and slipped a valet ticket under our door, no charge. FYI the 10th floor is also for hotel guests. Nice if we had known. The French doors to the bedroom from the living room don't lock!?! And there are very sheer curtains on them. I have never seen this in a suite hotel. OK, I have to say something positive about this place. The concierge were helpful whenever we had a question, and the location was very close to Sea World, which is why we stayed there. I would not stay there again, however.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it!!!”
Reviews.Author: djjm9
Reviews.Content: While the suite we had was indeed very nice, getting to the room was a chore and somewhat of a pain in the neck. the parking situation is ridiculous. You drive up this narrow cork screw ramp to the 11th floor, which is the one and only floor hotel guests may park. Once there the spaces are all too narrow and jammed together. If you're lucky enough to find a spot (a) back it in for an easy exit, DO NOT park head on. YOu will fight for your life to get your car out. It's way to crammed and just a mess. And other reviews are correct. Forget valet. You'll grow another head by the time the staff wake up from their siesta and go get your car. the neighborhood leaves a lot to be desired too. Within a block you'll find more homeless and drug dealers on the corners than in most any other city. And forget the Gaslamp District. It "ain't" worth it. Stay somewhere else. The Hotel Circle area off of I-8 is much more convenient for all your sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MomeeToEm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for a little mini vacation to escape the heat of inland Southern California. After reading reviews here we went ahead and used valet parking. Since we were only there for two nights we figured we'd splurge a little. In my opinion it was worth it. When we first arrived, our room was not ready, so we dug our bathing suits out of our luggage and used the pool for a while. We had the pool to ourselves for about 30 minutes. When we were done at the pool our room was ready and they upgraded us the "club" level, I assume because we had to wait for our room. We were on the 26th floor (hotel has 27 floor). We had a nice little view of the harbor, between two other taller buildings. The first night we were there we pulled out the sofa bed for my two year old. We noticed the bed was tilting quite a bit toward tthe head of the bed, but with pillows it was ok. It wasn't until the next morning when we tried to put the bed back in the sofa that we noticed one of the support bars was broken. We couldn't even get the bed back in the sofa. While we were out for the day the entire sofa was replaced. The only other issues we had was with room service. We used room service several times during our stay. With small children we felt it was an easy (although very, very expensive) option. Our first time ordering breakfast, some little things were not included, syrup for the pancakes, butter & jelly for the toast, etc. The other times we ordered we made sure to ask for everything we'd needed and our food arrived promptly and meet all or expectations. All in all, we had a great stay, we would definitely consider using this hotel again and felt the AAA rate price through the Sheraton website was reasonable compared to other "Suite" hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the last weekend of June. We were able to use a parking meter space on the street to unload the car and check in. Once we arrived in the room, we saw the mini bar was wide open and previous guest had taken quite a bit out. While my husband was on the phone with the front desk regarding the mini bar, our son used the bathroom and the toilet leaked from the base and flowed across the bathroom floor. The hotel switched us to another room. This room was much more worn than the first one. Bathroom was tired with dripping shower and sofa was dirty. Rest of the room was fine and clean. Fantastic view of balboa park. Walking distance to Gaslamp area. We were told parking was 20 dollars a day, though others on the board mention 15. Since we stayed two nights, this meant 60 total dollars on our bill. We chose to park on the street instead and save the money. We had no problems doing this. You just have to read the signage closely to know which side of the street to overnight on. Our oldest son stayed with his basketball team at the Hilton near hotel circle during this same weekend. He gave our room at Sheraton Suites a huge thumbs up and said the Hilton was not as nice. This would be a 16 year old's opinion. Also, while the sofa bed is HORRIBLE, (poor 12 year old son), the king bed my husband I shared was very comfortable and probably one of the best we've slept in at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the end of our trip, but bad Concierge”
Reviews.Author: divalibrarian
Reviews.Content: We decided to treat ourselves at the end of a 2 week trip and the Sheraton Suites lived up to expectations! A lovely room, space to relax and a great view but the pool was tiny! Location was good, easy to get to by car off the Interstate and close to the centre - a short walk to GasLamp district or the shore. Also a good location for the Zoo - we walked as the Concierge told us it was only a 15 min walk - it was definitely more like 30 min! Zoo was fantastic (but don't bother with the Deluxe ticket as you probably won't get your money's worth unless you go on the bus rides and skyfari several times) Also, I asked if it was possible to use public Transport to Seaworld and was told no - when in fact you can get the Trolley to Old Town and then the no. 9 bus all for $2.50 each way!
