(my fiance by that stage was tired of buses and we ended up paying $25 each way to Sea World in a taxi and then another $90 to get into Sea World! It wasn't worth it but if you do go remember to say you have an AA card as they give you a discount). Also a great local bar was the Bistro on 6th Ave corner - Jessie the Bar Manager was a great host and the Cheese Cake was a lovely way to end the holiday! Overall a great hotel in a great location but I think the Concierge should do some more research!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AMcTravel
Reviews.Content: Perfect Stay, Platinum Amenities great. Parking is ok, just try not to do the ramp more than a few times and you won't be upset. Walking distance great for Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Friendly Staff-Yes and older hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews from the past 6-months I was worried but I was also pragmatic as I knew that this hotel is older (there aren't many new hotels and if you want super hip or upscale than a boutique hotel is likely what you want) and hotel rates and taxes in downtown San Diego are high wherever you stay. I'm glad I booked this hotel anyway (love getting my Starwood points). Also, the "W" was 2.5x the cost and not as convenient for getting on and off the freeway etc. I was on the 20th floor in a corner upgrade-junior suite type. Yes, it's older, the wallpaper is dated (and a small corner is peeling in the bathroom) and the pocket door to the bathroom has seen better days BUT the room was immaculate, well appointed, has high speed Internet access, an ample refrigerator, microwave and the bed was comfortable. I liked the separate bedrioom and the chairs and couch in the main area are comfortable. The service is friendly if not outstanding. Room service is very expensive as is with most hotels but there are several deli's and restaurants within walking distance in the historic Gas Lamp Quarter. Since parking is expensive everywhere in downtown San Diego I took the advice I read in other reviews and just ponied up the extra $4.00 to use the valet service. It was worth it and the ticket implicity states to call down 15-20 minutes ahead of time (I discovered it's because the valet lot is actually a couple of city blocks away). For my 17-day stay I only had to wait longer than 15-minutes once.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DR_at_UZH
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, staff very helpful, beautifulview from room, but needs remodeling (in due time). Recetion is on the 12th floor, parking up to the 11th floor, extremely steep. Don't try it yourselv. Valet parking is worth the money - and very speedy and helpful. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property and I have stayed here on multiple occasions. I highly recommend staying here (something I rarely do). The value for the cost is wonderful versus other downtown San Diego hotels. The parking is tough (who would design such a building) so I suggest using the valet. The only drawback is the airplane traffic is a minor distraction on the north facing rooms. Getting a south facing room solves that problem and the view is spectacular (includes downtown San Diego and Coronado - the higher the room the better). The staff is very accommodating of room location requests. Enjoy this great hotel and San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Faison2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Suites San Diego for three days on business and this hotel has a lot to offer. It is located within walking distance to a lot of the downtown attractions or you could take the trolley which has a stop 2 blocks away. The hotel staff were also very nice and gave a lot of information on things to do in the area. I would not recommend renting a car and parking because I saw the fee to be $24/day, when you probably wouldn't do a lot of driving in the first place. Overall the rooms are clean and quiet. If ever again in the San Diego area, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service falls short”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: Stayed late december 2005. Parking by valet saves you a trip to the 11th floor, but at the cost of 15 minutes to 1/2 hour of your life--Mr. Valet Supervisor continues to man his post doing nothing, while his minion runs like crazy, while 10 people mill about doing nothing. This after calling down "calling ahead" as they advise. But you gotta give a good tip or it just gets worse... Club level free internet/free local calls--NOT! Check your bill, not free, 2 phone calls to reverse the charge and they still don't get it right. Overworked tired plumbing (variable hot water temperature, 'stuff' regurgitating from the sink (ick). Toilet successfully flushes 95% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice hotel, but not as good as expected. Parking was very inconvenient (on the 11th floor!) and expensive ($20 a night); the mechanics of the room were below expectations (shower dripped, pocket doors not hung correctly); some of the staff were inconsiderate of guests (concierge cut us off in the parking garage and a cleaning person decided to clean the glass walls with ammonia in the gym while guests were working out).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcjalujan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days/4 nights in July (July 18 - July 22). Overall very happy with this hotel. Good for family with younger children. Centrally located to attractions (Wild Animal Park, Zoo, Sea World, Legoland, Beaches, Downtown/Gaslamp). Walking distance to Downtown, a mall and the Gaslamp Dist. Staff (especially the front desk staff) was top notch. Quiet, clean two room suite with 2 TV's, fridge, bar. Staff allows you to store personal items in the fridge. Nice beds/pillows. The only areas of improvement could be updating the bathroom and replacing the sliding doors with standard doors. Nice indoor pool, however it is small, but again perfect for younger children. The pool was very warm the first day, but it got colder each day. Nice jacuzzi and work out room. Self park is a little weird as you have to drive up several floors to get to the hotel parking on the 11th floor. Consider using valet parking. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LuvToLearn
Reviews.Content: May, 2005. This hotel is in a great downtown location within walking distance of restaurants, the mall, a grocery store, etc. We reserved two suites with two double beds in each bedroom and a sleeper sofa in each seating area. There was a TV in each area, so that was nice. There was a stocked bar available in the seating area with juice, beer and liquor (can't recall what else) but we brought our own goodies because we had little ones with us, and staff was fine with that. They said to put all of their stuff in the cabinet next to the refrigerator and then replace it at check-out time so that we wouldn't have extra charges added to our bill. The parking cost $25 for valet daily. Excellent service from the parking people and no digs in the van. They double charged us for a suit we had pressed, but quickly deducted the amount when he brought it to their attention. My only complaint is that we'd requested (a week prior to our visit) foam pads for the foldout couches, but only one pad was available when we arrived. Everyone treated us royally from the time we arrived. Immaculately clean rooms and all staff was ready and eager to serve. On the second night of our stay the AC unit wasn't cooling in one of the suites but it was instantly repaired once we reported it (we even received about $15 off of our bill for our inconvenience). The indoor swimming pool was great and a beautiful restaurant with live music was available. We were extremely pleased with our visit and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are disabled--dont even think about staying here!”
Reviews.Author: WA frequent traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of a business conference. First they ran out of room block rooms so we ended up paying full rack rates. (I had to stay there or would have to taxi back and forth several times each day because I cannot walk a full block on unlevel ground without being in a wheelchair.) The conference rooms were extremely small and cramped. Since this was our first trip to San Diego, we also stayed for the weekend. We paid even more for those two days! Normally a conference rate continues after the conference is over for at least one night. Food at this hotel is outragiously expensive. The breakfast buffet for two, including tip, was over $40. A soft drink and sandwich at the Sky Bar (restaurant was not open on Sunday after breakfast) ran over $45 for two. I travel with a companion who has to help me physically. The handicapped suites ONLY come with one king bed and a sofa bed. The king bed was so high I could not get onto it from my wheelchair and had to be helped physically from a standing position to hike myself up onto the bed!!! The sofa bed was too low. Once down in it I would never get up again. The bed was not only high, but so full of pillows that they took up half the floor in the bedroom when we unloaded them at night. Not too good when you use aids to go from the bed to the bathroom in the middle of the night. The handicapped bathroom was fairly typical and very large. There were two doors one from the living room and one from the bedroom. Because of all the doors it was difficult to navigate once in there. There was no where to put my personal items in the bathroom....no shelves, no flat area around the sink, etc. So I have to carry them back and forth from the bedroom everytime that I went in there. And had to put them on the floor to use them. There was no comfortable seating in the so-called living room--even for regular people. There is only the sofa bed which is too low, the cushons are too soft, and frankly uncomfortable for two people. There was a desk chair. There were no other chairs. We really needed at least one upholstered chair with arms that would allow a handicapped person to get up and down with ease. Or allow a normal person to sit comfortably to watch tv etc. I wrote a lengthly letter to the hotel manager about the problems that I left with my card at the front desk on check out. To date I have received absolutely no response. I am a frequent Starwood guest. I have never ever in all my travels found a handicapped room that was more challenging than this one. Note: the desk staff were not well trained or knowledgeable. However twice we found very helpful informed staff handling the luggage. They gave us info on taxis, directions, recommended selection of restaurants at the Del Coronado hotel, etc. We had a bad experience with the shuttle from the airport. It turns out that this hotel is so close to the airport that taking a taxi is cheaper and much easier. The shuttles involved going up and down in an elevator and over a bridge at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton suites for 5 nights in March for a conference. The staff were very friendly even though we had to wait a while to check in. We had requested a King bed and we got exactly that but the bathroom was a little odd. It was very plain and there was no bath. We had a slightly musty smell in the room, probably from the air conditioning unit and whilst the room probably could have done with some updating it was very clean. We had the breakfast buffet and thought it was good even though it was a little overpriced. Bottles of water were available in the rooms for a crazy price of 4 dollars. My opinion is water should be free but that's just large chain hotels I guess. The fitness room was great but the pool was very small, great for kids but no good if you're a serious swimmer. To summarise, the hotel is in a great location for the gas-lamp district. It was very clean and the staff very friendly. We probably wouldn't stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Wonderful Bed”
Reviews.Author: TAS-Wine_Drinker
Reviews.Content: The beds were wonderful with great sheets and just really comfortable. We thought our room was nice, as well as the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred person and have stayed at all the Starwood places in town (Westin, W, etc.). This hotel is the best value in town. Rooms are spacious with great work space. Bathrooms are a little dated but clean and well equipped. Sweet Sleeper beds are exactly like Heavenly Beds but with different covers. The location is a bit removed from downtown (at least where my meetings were) but San Diego is so small that it made no difference. I ordered Chinese from outside the hotel which was delivered to my room within 30 minutes. I would definitely stay here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SCashCalifornia
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an EXTREMELY comfortable, high-class hotel, this is it. The bed is a fantasy - I kept waking up before my alarm, fully rested and ready to go, because I actually slept the whole night very deeply. Better than at home, even! The rooms are very well appointed and clean, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. About the only bad thing was the room service prices ($8 for one scoop of ice cream +$3 delivery charge +18% tip) and the parking lot was treacherous to get in and out of. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Oh so Suite!”
Reviews.Author: wkrik
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all over San Diego when we visit, this is now the only place. Their web site usually has weekend specials, and ask for an upgrade when you arrive. Enjoy your sleep in their heavenly beds. We have always been upgraded for free ever time we stayed. situated perfectly just 3 blocks from the gas lamp district and downtown it is a perfect spot. 2 blocks is a trolly stop and you can take a 40 minute trip straight to the border for $2.50 and $5 taxi to Tijuana shopping area.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Suites San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 701 A. Street, San Diego, CA 92101
